title: Diary of a Future President
plot: A young Cuban-American girl embarks on a journey to become the future president of the United States.
actors: Tess Romero, Selenis Leyva, Charlie Bushnell, Michael Weaver
Review_audience: ['They really stepped up their game here! It was witty, fun and really developed the characters! Bring on season 3!', "Diary of a Future President is back with its second season on Disney+. This season follows three storylines featuring the Cañero-Reed family. The first plot is that Elena is running for school rep but has many challenges along the way.  The second plot follows Bobby as he learns how to express his sexuality and feel more comfortable with it. The third and final plot follows Gabi and Sam as they learn more about each other as their relationship grows. The plot that was the strongest out of the three was Bobby's arc. Bobby's character arc felt cohesive throughout the whole season without any large bumps in the road. Bobby as a whole felt upgraded as he made new friends and still kept his older ones. Yes, there were a couple of episodes that felt a little cliche, but it worked for Bobby's storyline. I do wish that we got a little bit more time between him and Liam in the second half of the season. It was such an integral part of Bobby's character in the first season, and I think it got a tiny bit lost near the end of the season. Although, Bobby getting together with CJ was nice to see. The second best plot out of the three is Elena's arc and her desire to earn the role of student president. Elena was a strong character throughout the season, yet I still think she was slightly flawed. Elena got herself into a new problem every episode which got a little repetitive after a few episodes since some of them had similar tones. Yes, it all leads to Elena realizing that she needs to focus on others and not just herself if she wants to be student president. However, I don't think the payoff was executed well and felt a bit rushed. Although what I did appreciate was that there was very little drama surrounding Elena and her friends. The first season had too much of that and took away from the show at certain moments. If this show gets a season three, I believe it should focus more on making Elena's actions throughout each episode feel more cohesive and spread out to allow a bigger payoff at the end of the season. Lastly, I found Sam and Gabi's plot to be the weakest of the three. However, I did really like a lot of the storylines they had in the first few episodes. Although, I wish that the writers kept it going throughout the whole season as it focused more on Gabi near the end. There was no problem with it focusing more on Gabi, but it did feel like Sam wasn't doing anything in the last 2-3 episodes. I believe that if Sam connected to the kids a bit more in other episodes, it would have helped his character out a lot. Even with the minor complaints I have about the writing this season, the show does continue to be an enjoyable watch. It is a definite step-up from the first season, which was very kid-centric. This season felt more mature with many significant storylines that any parent, teen, or adult could relate to. Those aspects of the show are brought together with an outstanding cast. Tess Romero and Selenis Leyva were both so superb this season. If this show gets picked up for a season 3, I would love to see more of the mature and relatable writing combined with even more excellent character development that made this season of Diary of a Future President such a fun watch.", "It's characters have some added flaws to boost the messages, but it's progressive and cute elements make them tolerable in an impressive, mature family show.", "I love this show especially  Bobby's storyline in this season"]

title: Amphibia
plot: Ordinary Anne Boonchuy, 13, finds a treasure chest that sends her to Amphibia, a world full of frogs, toads, and giant insects. With help from Sprig, she must adjust to life in Amphibia and discover her first true friendship in her life.
genre: Animation, Short, Adventure, Comedy, Family, Fantasy
writer: Matt Braly
actors: Brenda Song, Justin Felbinger, Bill Farmer, Amanda Leighton
Review_audience:
["This season wasted way too much time, definitely has its high points however too much time with a wasted on plot points that never really had to pay off in the end. The perfect example of this is the second half of the Season where an army is built up over the span of a ton of episodes only to be discarded for the finale and final battle almost completely. Well this season also introduced an incredible villain along King Andreas that particular villain which I found particularly interesting and compelling never really got a chance this time besides the end of the show when it was already a little bit too. The first half was fine but had a big emotional Whiplash from the dramatic ending of True Colors to Slice of Life episodes on Earth without breaking up the traumatic events of the finale of the last season. A couple of plot points also just come out of nowhere with no previous setup and satisfying payoff. Overall I feel like this season wasted too much time for the story was trying to tell. I'll remember amphibia fondly as a pleasant show not a perfect one but definitely one I recommend watching.", 'The finale was epic.', "The first half of the season is pretty fun, but nowhere near as good as 2 episodes that take place in Amphibia.  The second half before the finale is decent, and only one really stands out. But, it's all worth it for an amazing 3-part finale, which is really phenomenal.", 'All ages admitted!!!!!!!! The greatest final 18 episodes ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!', 'While it still has a considerable amount of frustrating fillers, the final season of Amphibia at least builds everything up to an emotionally and visually satisfying finale.', 'it was great, i swear, i never got so attached to a show this much.', 'The first time I watched Amphibia was with my son,  after that I was hooked! Love it!', 'Good season. All episodes were consistently fun and enjoyable to watch while managing to hit home the more dramatic moments. Thematic and character writing are really strong which more than makes up for some issues regarding tone and pacing. Does the season have problems? Yes. But personally, it never detracts from the overall experience of the show. It manages to be a solid finely crafted vibe through and through. For that, I believe this last stretch stuck the landing to cement this show among the peak. 5/5', 'at some point it was boring but now the last season of amphibia will possibly become one of the best seasons for an animated series', "It so far is okay. I've definitely seen better for sure. Honestly this show is just very bland and boring.", 'The first half changed up the formula of the show a lot, however some of the earth episodes are pretty good, but now the second half appears to be amazing by going back to the old formula while still adding a new spin on it. Plus the story is becoming very important with questions being answered that have been waiting for years to be answered.', 'this season is great!', 'I can only review the first half of the season at this point, but my problems with this stretch of the series is threefold: 

1)  The Plantars are now in LA for what amounts to at least 18 episodes.  As it turns out, when you remove a fantasy story from its own setting, it ceases to feel like the same show.  I watched Amphibia because I love the world, and I love how that world was built and animated.  They took what I love about the show most and removed it.  I could tell they wanted to try something new and different, but it was a creative risk that failed, big time.  

2)  The obvious: the placement of these episodes makes them frustrating filler.  I spent the whole time internally yelling, "BUT WHAT IS GOING ON IN AMPHIBIA?!?!"  I got two episodes detailing Amphibia, and that was it.  It was torture.  

3)  These LA episodes rely on Clark Kent logic.  No one can tell they're talking to giant technicolor frogs because of hats, wigs, glasses and a fake nose made of clay.  A face mask does not change the fact that the rest of Sprig is HOT PINK.  And when their disguises do come off, which is often, most people are fairly whatevs about it.  It's pushing suspension of disbelief even by kid's cartoon standards.   

I find myself increasingly wishing that at the end of season 2, due to the music box malfunctioning or some other accident, the Plantars and Anne were blasted to another continent in the Amphibia world.  Andreas thinks they're dead or elsewhere and they have to fight their way back to Amphibia.  It would have been a much better way to include that episodic hijinks and adventure structure they're going for, while keeping the tone of the show more intact.  

My advice?  Binge all of Season 3 when it's fully out and race through the LA episodes, if you watch them at all.']

Review_audience:
['Just about perfect in every sense of the word. Very funny, with a great mystery and solid tension. 10/10, would recommend to everyone looking for a great show.', 'Such a beautiful series! I do not understand why it is only 2 seasons. One of the best adult animes I have ever watched. Fun, sincere and mysterious at the same time..', "Even better than season 1, if that's even possible, i wish the series would have continued. But it still had a very satisfying ending", 'Beautiful and hilarious! All ages (10+) will enjoy!', 'I cry every single time this show ends. It was perfect, the whole thing. Best cartoon out there, honest.', "One of the best shows I've ever seen.  This was amazing.  Watched it with my older 2 kids.  We were so sad to finish it.", "Second part of an absolute classic!
It picks up the story right where it left off, so the two seasons really belong together, they are meant to be watched one after another, because they assemble one huge story, which unfolds in two phases.
The story and the humour never gets old, the mysteries get more tense, and the stakes get higher. This is the outcome of the first season's buildup, and the final pays off amazingly.
Surely many of us will remember this unusual and unfogettable summer for a very long time.", "Chef's kiss. This show is awesome", "This is also of the most awesome Disney cartoon ever made! Gravity Falls may be gone, but the show's legacy goes on. The shipping of Dipcifica, the reveal of Stan's twin brother, character development of our main protagonists. Hirsch's legacy gives us everything and it's all thanks to him. 100/10. :)", 'Gravity Falls es y será siempre uno de los mejores programas animados de todos los tiempos.', 'What can I say? Its Gravity Falls, just one of the very best animated shows ever.', 'The show has hit its peak, all of its strengths remain, and the much greater plot progression shows that the mostly episodic style of the first season was not chosen for a of lack of overarching plot. Mysteries have satisfying answers, the horror elements are dialed up and the humor and characters are stronger than ever. The show ended on its own terms and in a meaningful way to boot.', 'Going deeper on the mystery and clearing it up in a satisfying way, this continually-addicting show is a blast in the entertainment department, and a surprisingly mature showcase for all-ages storytelling.', 'Now they do really go all out in the finale. It felt like they spared no expenses. It also definitely felt like way more than 2 seasons worth of substance. I recommend rewatching it at least twice and reading up on all the easter eggs. The ending was a good one as well.', 'I have spent countless hours watching Gravity Falls, And it never disappoints me. Every time I watch the show I find new hidden details and  the show has helped me a lot as a child getting over depression and it always makes me laugh.', 'What season 2 looses in innocent charm it gains in dramatic exposition, building on season 1 to become a purely entertaining storyline of perfect adventures, perfect humor, and perfect relationship complexity.', 'If you dislike this show, I will hunt you down.', 'A 2°Temporada segue com a história que foi antes iniciada, tão boa quanto a primeira (talvez até melhor), expandindo o universo e revelando com o passar dos episódios a grande história da série. Continua incrível, com os personagens que tanto amamos e outros novos, tem plot twists inacreditáveis e sensacionais! Gravity Falls terminou cedo, mas terminou bem. Também vale a pena ler o livro do Diário do Stanford Pines, pois completa informações sobre alguns personagens e seres já conhecido e ainda acompanhamos a trajetória do personagem. É uma das melhores séries animadas de todas e realmente espero que um dia volte!', 'Good finale and interesting characters but Mabel kinda ruins it for me.', '-The finale is striking and heartwarming all at once', 'Amazing finale. Fantastic show. I want another season.', 'Gravity Falls was outstanding from the get-go, and even in season 2, it was and is marvelous. I highly recommend it', "This is defiantly absolutely!  my favourite  TV show ever and i don't think that will ever change in a million year! what make this show amazing is the secrets there are so man!!!!
If you haven't seen this...... your missing out on A LOT  you must watching you will like it !", "The show Gravity Falls is filled with many twists and turns and can keep anyone entertained for its run time of 21 minutes.  The kids in the show- Mabel and Dipper- find themselves in situations that are so well written, that it can be difficult to tell where the story is going.  Because the imagination of the writers of this show is beyond anyone's wildest dreams, every show feels like a unique experience.  The series also has many great morals for kids that it expertly communicates.  This series is an absolute must-see for any kid, and could probably entertain most adults, and has a great sense of humor!", "A must see! It's an amazing show with great lore. 1000/10. I would watch again.", 'Easily the best season of the best Disney show so far. I loved how they did not stretch the story and gave it a very good conclusion. If only Disney made shows like this right now...', 'An absolute must see!!!', "It's good. ‏‏‎ ‎‏‏‎ ‎", 'Just as good as season 1, and maybe even better! I love this show so much, it holds a very special place in my heart! <3', 'Best animated tv show ever. No one is ever too old to watch the adventure, mystery, and excitement this shows brings.', 'Gravity Falls Season 1 was amazing, especially with the reveal at the end of the season. Season 2 greatly elevates the mystery element of the show. There is just a lot find out now. The series reaches it's peak with "Not What he Seems" and continues to get better and better. This a show that will last a life time.', 'Very Fun And Interesting', 'Best show everrrr. Absoulutly the best season. This is a brilliant season with such an amazing plot.', "I haven't rewatched this season of gravity falls yet but from what I remember it was one of my favourite seasons from the show, I remember season 2 giving some 90s feels, Giving me some tears, And found this season very funny, It is sad that the show had to end but it will forever be missed. I give gravity falls season 2 5/5 stars, It is sad that gravity falls had to end but who knows maybe Alex Hirsch will return gravity falls for a season 3.", 'Gravity Falls is perhaps the best Disney animated series since they had a TV channel. The writing of the episodes is absolutely brilliant and enjoyable by everyone! The story is so fascinating and deep that every episode kept the audience speculating. Gravity Falls never fails to amaze me with every single episode!
My personal favourites are Episode 10, Episode 11, Episode 12, Episode 13, Episode 15, Episode 17 and the Weirdmageddon trilogy.
Episode 10 was the creepiest of the bunch, with some of the best visuals in the series. The story behind the episode was genius and I give the writers massive props for having the balls to put that "Ancient Sins" scene in!
Episode 11 served as the culmination of everything that happened in the series so far and not a single second was a disappointment! The reveal in the end had my jaw on the floor.
Episode 12 was, in my opinion, the most fascinating and beautiful episode from a storytelling perspective. It served it's purpose and was my favourite until the last episode.
Episode 13 established the characters and was a massive load of pure fun.
Episode 15 had 2 branching stories that both served a purpose, with one being Mable's adventure and one being Dipper's revelation. Mable's adventure was cute and fun, while Dipper's did it's job MARVELOUSLY.
Episode 17 was definitely the most interesting of them. The part with Dipper and Ford was a satisfactory action fested beauty while Mable's stuff set up the end of the episode in the best way possible. And the end... Wow was it good! The best way possible to set up the finale!
Weirdmageddon... What can I say? Perhaps the best ending to a show I've seen since Death Note. An emotion trip filled with fun, amazement and satisfaction. Shout-out to Bill's performance of We'll Meet Again because you all know you loved it. It was action packed, weird in the best way and just awesome! 
Overall, Gravity Falls was and still is a masterpiece that I'll never forget.', 'This show is like a dream come true. Absolutely amazing.', "It is very action-packed.  My favorite part of season 2 is the final episode.  There's as much action in one episode as in the Avengers.  I give it a 20 out of 10.", 'Season two is when the story really starts to pick up. We have lots of more appearances from Bill Cipher, the real Stanford coming back from another dimension, and the deep connection that Dipper and Mabel have. With all of that and a very emotional and rewarding Ending I would defiantly recommend this, just watch season one first', "The story arc continues and the mysteries of Gravity Falls are slowly peeled away.
More adventures await Dipper, Mabel, their uncle and their friends, but before the end of this summer vacation we'll need everybody to band together to save the town and everybody in it!", "I'm a 13-year-old girl with a pretty short attention span when it comes to TV shows, but this is truly a piece of art. I've never seen anything like it; it's so unique and made me paranoid as hell, but that's a good thing as I think it's what the show was trying to do! Gravity Falls is definitely the best cartoon released in the 21st century. Wonderful characters and great themes. This show had me in tears by the finale and I'll never forget it. I really recommend that you give it a try. What's the worst that could happen?", 'El nivel de emocion, de referencias, de intriga y de diversion aumenta a nivel que va pasando cada capitulo, hasta llegar al final que es creo el mejor de una comiquita de TV de Disney, sencillamente la mejor serie...', 'Season 2 of Gravity Falls takes the already near perfect 1st season and some how makes it even better. It\x92s always nice to see a show end on its own terms.', "Just like the first season, but is a whole lot better. Gravity Falls season 2 still continues to make funny humour and old fashioned storytelling come to life once again, but this time the series focuses on several plot lines at a time, and Disney makes that work. The series still has compelling  episodes like the first and the episodes still keep you on the edge of your seat. The best episode was the movie like special Weirdmaggedon. This episode wasn't good because it was a special, it was good because it was extremely entertaining and you was always worried about what Bill would do next, so it was jaw dropping. The finale was quite emotional and I expect to see more things about Gravity Falls ( a movie). Overall Gravity Falls Season 2 is the best series and I recommend you binge watch the show.", "Overrated dribble this show gets high marks only because it is a children's show and yet most of the fans and critics says it's for adults which seems to be like having your cake and eating it too which too me seems ridiculous. This show is nothing special it steals most of it's ideas from either old TV melodramas like twin peaks or murder she wrote terrible show full of bad acting some overacting some underacting but mostly the prior. It also steals a lot from other american sitcoms like the Simpsons which has a similar wacky city where extraordinary things happen. 

It even stole it's main characters from the Simpsons dipper is a combination of Lisa Simpson and Bart Simpson being a whiny know it all brat who has to be the center of attention and a stupid little boy who for some reason wants to have a girlfriend who is many years his senior. The sister is Lisa if she had suffered a brain injury and had suddenly become infatuated with pigs and glitter or Bart as a girl but much less likable and also probably suffering from a brain injury. The old man with the stupid nickname (I refuse to say it's too stupid) is basically the old man from UP mixed with the personality of homer Simpson and the charm and wit of a rock. 

Then a tortilla chip tries to take over the world but is fooled by said idiot who looks the old man from up with the wit of a rock and his slightly more intelligent twin brother. You also have an even uglier and stupider version of Chris from the equally overrated plot-less humorless and idiotic family guy. Gravity falls has none of charm humor or creativity of the classic Simpsons some of convoluted plot and bad acting from twin peaks and murder she wrote an idiotic villain who is easily fooled and defeated and a cliche boring ending.", "Oh, the thrills, the laughs, the goosebumpy feeling that this show gives me (it means that I'm emotional)... Gravity Falls holds a special place for me alongside the very best shows I've seen.", 'One of the absolute best animated shows to come to television!', 'Gravity Falls is still my all time favorite animated show and one of my top 5 favorite shows of all time. This was another season filled with phenomenal animation; cool, cute, creepy, and weird creatures; and funny writing and weird and crazy stories. The ensemble of performances are outstanding especially from Kristen Schaal, Alex Hirsch, Jason Ritter, J.K. Simmons, Linda Cardellini, Jennifer Coolidge, Carl Faruolo, Thurop Van Orman, Niki Yang, T.J. Miller, Justin Roiland, Will Forte, Gregg Turkington, Sam Marin, Patton Oswalt, Neil deGrasse Tyson, Peter Serafinowicz, John DiMaggio, Nathan Fillion, Keith Ferguson, Jackie Buscarino, Kevin Michael Richardson, Alfred Molina, Jon Stewart, Weird Al Yankovic, Louis C.K., Mark Hamill, Stephen Root, Chelsea Peretti, and Jessica DiCicco. Also the music is terrific. An A+ 2nd and final season, the finale is to me my favorite and one of the all time best finales ever.', 'Such a great and engaging story with loveable and memorable characters. A must watch for everyone. Sad to see it go.']
Review_critics: ['Even if some of the fantasy elements feel overly familiar, the characters are anything but.', "Gravity Falls treats its young viewers with respect, and with a lot of trust. It never gives the impression of tricking kids into seeing something they shouldn't... just tricking their parents into letting them see something they might not be allowed to.", "You may have to wrestle with Disney XD's downright disrespectful broadcast schedule to find the rare new episodes, but trust us, it will be worth it.", "I don't care how old you are, if you're not watching Gravity Falls you're missing out on some of the cleverest, most enjoyable television you can find.", "It's funny, emotional, beautiful, and terrifying in equal measure.", "It's always nice to see a show end on its own terms, especially when those terms are as beautifully executed as Gravity Falls' series finale.", "We can't go back, but we do have the memories. We have the time spent in one of the most fully realized fictional worlds to ever grace the TV screen. We have the brilliant and funny characters.", 'Gravity Falls" deserves to be in the conversation... when people discuss the best animated programming of the \'10s. It is a beautiful blend of old-fashioned storytelling with a modern sense of humor that never feels like it\'s talking down to kids.']

Mysteries have satisfying answers, the horror elements are dialed up and the humor and characters are stronger than ever. The show ended on its own terms and in a meaningful way to boot.', 'Going deeper on the mystery and clearing it up in a satisfying way, this continually-addicting show is a blast in the entertainment department, and a surprisingly mature showcase for all-ages storytelling.', 'Now they do really go all out in the finale. It felt like they spared no expenses. It also definitely felt like way more than 2 seasons worth of substance. I recommend rewatching it at least twice and reading up on all the easter eggs. The ending was a good one as well.', 'I have spent countless hours watching Gravity Falls, And it never disappoints me. Every time I watch the show I find new hidden details and  the show has helped me a lot as a child getting over depression and it always makes me laugh.', 'What season 2 looses in innocent charm it gains in dramatic exposition, building on season 1 to become a purely entertaining storyline of perfect adventures, perfect humor, and perfect relationship complexity.', 'If you dislike this show, I will hunt you down.', 'A 2°Temporada segue com a história que foi antes iniciada, tão boa quanto a primeira (talvez até melhor), expandindo o universo e revelando com o passar dos episódios a grande história da série. Continua incrível, com os personagens que tanto amamos e outros novos, tem plot twists inacreditáveis e sensacionais! Gravity Falls terminou cedo, mas terminou bem. Também vale a pena ler o livro do Diário do Stanford Pines, pois completa informações sobre alguns personagens e seres já conhecido e ainda acompanhamos a trajetória do personagem. É uma das melhores séries animadas de todas e realmente espero que um dia volte!', 'Good finale and interesting characters but Mabel kinda ruins it for me.', '-The finale is striking and heartwarming all at once', 'Amazing finale. Fantastic show. I want another season.', 'Gravity Falls was outstanding from the get-go, and even in season 2, it was and is marvelous. I highly recommend it', "This is defiantly absolutely!  my favourite  TV show ever and i don't think that will ever change in a million year! what make this show amazing is the secrets there are so man!!!!
If you haven't seen this...... your missing out on A LOT  you must watching you will like it !", "The show Gravity Falls is filled with many twists and turns and can keep anyone entertained for its run time of 21 minutes.  The kids in the show- Mabel and Dipper- find themselves in situations that are so well written, that it can be difficult to tell where the story is going.  Because the imagination of the writers of this show is beyond anyone's wildest dreams, every show feels like a unique experience.  The series also has many great morals for kids that it expertly communicates.  This series is an absolute must-see for any kid, and could probably entertain most adults, and has a great sense of humor!", "A must see! It's an amazing show with great lore. 1000/10. I would watch again.", 'Easily the best season of the best Disney show so far. I loved how they did not stretch the story and gave it a very good conclusion. If only Disney made shows like this right now...', 'An absolute must see!!!', "It's good. ‏‏‎ ‎‏‏‎ ‎", 'Just as good as season 1, and maybe even better! I love this show so much, it holds a very special place in my heart! <3', 'Best animated tv show ever. No one is ever too old to watch the adventure, mystery, and excitement this shows brings.', 'Gravity Falls Season 1 was amazing, especially with the reveal at the end of the season. Season 2 greatly elevates the mystery element of the show. There is just a lot find out now. The series reaches it's peak with "Not What he Seems" and continues to get better and better. This a show that will last a life time.', 'Very Fun And Interesting', 'Best show everrrr. Absoulutly the best season. This is a brilliant season with such an amazing plot.', "I haven't rewatched this season of gravity falls yet but from what I remember it was one of my favourite seasons from the show, I remember season 2 giving some 90s feels, Giving me some tears, And found this season very funny, It is sad that the show had to end but it will forever be missed. I give gravity falls season 2 5/5 stars, It is sad that gravity falls had to end but who knows maybe Alex Hirsch will return gravity falls for a season 3.", 'Gravity Falls is perhaps the best Disney animated series since they had a TV channel. The writing of the episodes is absolutely brilliant and enjoyable by everyone! The story is so fascinating and deep that every episode kept the audience speculating. Gravity Falls never fails to amaze me with every single episode!
My personal favourites are Episode 10, Episode 11, Episode 12, Episode 13, Episode 15, Episode 17 and the Weirdmageddon trilogy.
Episode 10 was the creepiest of the bunch, with some of the best visuals in the series. The story behind the episode was genius and I give the writers massive props for having the balls to put that "Ancient Sins" scene in!
Episode 11 served as the culmination of everything that happened in the series so far and not a single second was a disappointment! The reveal in the end had my jaw on the floor.
Episode 12 was, in my opinion, the most fascinating and beautiful episode from a storytelling perspective. It served it's purpose and was my favourite until the last episode.
Episode 13 established the characters and was a massive load of pure fun.
Episode 15 had 2 branching stories that both served a purpose, with one being Mable's adventure and one being Dipper's revelation. Mable's adventure was cute and fun, while Dipper's did it's job MARVELOUSLY.
Episode 17 was definitely the most interesting of them. The part with Dipper and Ford was a satisfactory action fested beauty while Mable's stuff set up the end of the episode in the best way possible. And the end... Wow was it good! The best way possible to set up the finale!
Weirdmageddon... What can I say? Perhaps the best ending to a show I've seen since Death Note. An emotion trip filled with fun, amazement and satisfaction. Shout-out to Bill's performance of We'll Meet Again because you all know you loved it. It was action packed, weird in the best way and just awesome! 
Overall, Gravity Falls was and still is a masterpiece that I'll never forget.', 'This show is like a dream come true. Absolutely amazing.', "It is very action-packed.  My favorite part of season 2 is the final episode.  There's as much action in one episode as in the Avengers.  I give it a 20 out of 10.", 'Season two is when the story really starts to pick up. We have lots of more appearances from Bill Cipher, the real Stanford coming back from another dimension, and the deep connection that Dipper and Mabel have. With all of that and a very emotional and rewarding Ending I would defiantly recommend this, just watch season one first', "The story arc continues and the mysteries of Gravity Falls are slowly peeled away.
More adventures await Dipper, Mabel, their uncle and their friends, but before the end of this summer vacation we'll need everybody to band together to save the town and everybody in it!", "I'm a 13-year-old girl with a pretty short attention span when it comes to TV shows, but this is truly a piece of art. I've never seen anything like it; it's so unique and made me paranoid as hell, but that's a good thing as I think it's what the show was trying to do! Gravity Falls is definitely the best cartoon released in the 21st century. Wonderful characters and great themes. This show had me in tears by the finale and I'll never forget it. I really recommend that you give it a try. What's the worst that could happen?", 'El nivel de emocion, de referencias, de intriga y de diversion aumenta a nivel que va pasando cada capitulo, hasta llegar al final que es creo el mejor de una comiquita de TV de Disney, sencillamente la mejor serie...', 'Season 2 of Gravity Falls takes the already near perfect 1st season and some how makes it even better. It\x92s always nice to see a show end on its own terms.', "Just like the first season, but is a whole lot better. Gravity Falls season 2 still continues to make funny humour and old fashioned storytelling come to life once again, but this time the series focuses on several plot lines at a time, and Disney makes that work. The series still has compelling  episodes like the first and the episodes still keep you on the edge of your seat. The best episode was the movie like special Weirdmaggedon. This episode wasn't good because it was a special, it was good because it was extremely entertaining and you was always worried about what Bill would do next, so it was jaw dropping. The finale was quite emotional and I expect to see more things about Gravity Falls ( a movie). Overall Gravity Falls Season 2 is the best series and I recommend you binge watch the show.", "Overrated dribble this show gets high marks only because it is a children's show and yet most of the fans and critics says it's for adults which seems to be like having your cake and eating it too which too me seems ridiculous. This show is nothing special it steals most of it's ideas from either old TV melodramas like twin peaks or murder she wrote terrible show full of bad acting some overacting some underacting but mostly the prior. It also steals a lot from other american sitcoms like the Simpsons which has a similar wacky city where extraordinary things happen. 

It even stole it's main characters from the Simpsons dipper is a combination of Lisa Simpson and Bart Simpson being a whiny know it all brat who has to be the center of attention and a stupid little boy who for some reason wants to have a girlfriend who is many years his senior. The sister is Lisa if she had suffered a brain injury and had suddenly become infatuated with pigs and glitter or Bart as a girl but much less likable and also probably suffering from a brain injury. The old man with the stupid nickname (I refuse to say it's too stupid) is basically the old man from UP mixed with the personality of homer Simpson and the charm and wit of a rock. 

Then a tortilla chip tries to take over the world but is fooled by said idiot who looks the old man from up with the wit of a rock and his slightly more intelligent twin brother. You also have an even uglier and stupider version of Chris from the equally overrated plot-less humorless and idiotic family guy. Gravity falls has none of charm humor or creativity of the classic Simpsons some of convoluted plot and bad acting from twin peaks and murder she wrote an idiotic villain who is easily fooled and defeated and a cliche boring ending.", "Oh, the thrills, the laughs, the goosebumpy feeling that this show gives me (it means that I'm emotional)... Gravity Falls holds a special place for me alongside the very best shows I've seen.", 'One of the absolute best animated shows to come to television!', 'Gravity Falls is still my all time favorite animated show and one of my top 5 favorite shows of all time. This was another season filled with phenomenal animation; cool, cute, creepy, and weird creatures; and funny writing and weird and crazy stories. The ensemble of performances are outstanding especially from Kristen Schaal, Alex Hirsch, Jason Ritter, J.K. Simmons, Linda Cardellini, Jennifer Coolidge, Carl Faruolo, Thurop Van Orman, Niki Yang, T.J. Miller, Justin Roiland, Will Forte, Gregg Turkington, Sam Marin, Patton Oswalt, Neil deGrasse Tyson, Peter Serafinowicz, John DiMaggio, Nathan Fillion, Keith Ferguson, Jackie Buscarino, Kevin Michael Richardson, Alfred Molina, Jon Stewart, Weird Al Yankovic, Louis C.K., Mark Hamill, Stephen Root, Chelsea Peretti, and Jessica DiCicco. Also the music is terrific. An A+ 2nd and final season, the finale is to me my favorite and one of the all time best finales ever.', 'Such a great and engaging story with loveable and memorable characters. A must watch for everyone. Sad to see it go.']
Review_critics: ['Even if some of the fantasy elements feel overly familiar, the characters are anything but.', "Gravity Falls treats its young viewers with respect, and with a lot of trust. It never gives the impression of tricking kids into seeing something they shouldn't... just tricking their parents into letting them see something they might not be allowed to.", "You may have to wrestle with Disney XD's downright disrespectful broadcast schedule to find the rare new episodes, but trust us, it will be worth it.", "I don't care how old you are, if you're not watching Gravity Falls you're missing out on some of the cleverest, most enjoyable television you can find.", "It's funny, emotional, beautiful, and terrifying in equal measure.", "It's always nice to see a show end on its own terms, especially when those terms are as beautifully executed as Gravity Falls' series finale.", "We can't go back, but we do have the memories. We have the time spent in one of the most fully realized fictional worlds to ever grace the TV screen. We have the brilliant and funny characters.", 'Gravity Falls" deserves to be in the conversation... when people discuss the best animated programming of the \'10s. It is a beautiful blend of old-fashioned storytelling with a modern sense of humor that never feels like it\'s talking down to kids.']

Review_audience:
['The funniest version of Phineas and Ferb!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! LOL, all ages!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!', 'Season 2 is fun. I think they did well with the Phineas and Ferb crossover.', 'The second season of Milo is very exciting with great moments and a great end of the season satisfactory, the only thing that is not as glorious as the first season... with unnecessary characters and relies heavily on Phineas and Ferb.', "The second season of this cartoon, about a middle schooler who attracts chaos and destruction wherever he goes, remains fun but not as much as the first season.

The writing remains smart and the cast's personalities diverse and likable. Again they manage to weave in an overarching plot, this time involving aliens, beneath the individual shenanigans.  Although, it isn't quite as strong as the previous season's. Weird Al Yankovich does a great job as Milo Murphy. Although he uses his basic voice, he's surprisingly good at fitting a persona, and I would forget it's him. Animation remains colorful.

The biggest issue with this season is that it adds Dr. Doofenshmirtz from Phineas and Ferb. Now don't get me wrong, I loved him in his original show and consider him one of the top funny villains of all time. But here, he draws too much focus. A lot less time is spent at Milo's school with his classmates and the absence was felt. Doofenshmirtz just doesn't fit in. Even his character design differs. He had a nice send-off at the end of Phineas and Ferb and his story should have ended with that. However, his creators are just too fond of him. They did not one but two backdoor pilots for the guy during that show. They need to kill their darling and focus on their new content. 

Overall, I was still entertained with this. It's good-natured fun for your children."]

plot: Star Butterfly arrives on Earth to live with the Diaz, a Mexican-American family. She continues to battle villains throughout the universe and high school, mainly to protect her extremely powerful wand, an object that still confuses her.

Review_audience:
['Finale was a little lackluster, but it was definitely worth it. Followed the show since the first season and watched it as it came out. One of the best cartoons of the 2010s, imo', 'Star Vs As Forças do Mal no geral é uma série legal e divertida, com personagens muito carismáticos, talvez um dos melhores desenhos da Disney XD. Infelizmente, a série teve um final forçado e muito fraco. A 4° temporada poderia tranquilamente terminar a série, com Mewni sendo governada por uma adoradora de monstros, e muitos dos episódios tratam exatamente dessa adaptação da Eclipsa com ajuda de Star e Marco. Gosto dessa temporada até certo ponto, primeiramente, porque Star teve que terminar seu namoro com Tom? Talvez pra fazer fan service para os fãs malucos por "Starco", um casal que eu não apoiava inclusive. Segundo, a Lua como a grande vilã é a coisa mais ridícula que eu já vi, isso com certeza foi uma decisão desesperada e muito precipitada de que fez essa série. Terceiro, pra que destruir a mágica? Essa era a graça da série. Se tivesse uma 5° temporada, não sei como se sustentaria. Concluíndo, a série acaba com um final forçado, um casal forçado e uma vilã forçada, enfim, nada me agradou nesse final, fechou com uma verdadeira "chave de bosta" e anulou todas as coisas boas das outras 3 temporadas.', 'The final season manages to be a heavy improvement compared to the last two, but feels overwhelmed with what it's given. I loved the animation and I really enjoyed a lot more episodes this time, but the story sadly suffers greatly. Too much time is devoted to "shipping" and add layers to it that weren't really needed. The overall theme of prejudiced now feels more forced than ever and even the humor doesn't help. There was one joke that had me horrified and disgusted so much that I completely blanked out on the rest of the episode ( i.e. Ferguson confuses Mariposa for Marco & Star's "baby")!! It's definitely a mixed bag and it's finale is greatly underwhelming, probably the worst i have ever seen from a TV series. If you have thoughts on binging this series, I would highly recommend not checking it out, and definitely, if possible, avoid having your child watch it. The jokes and themes will impact them in very negative ways, take that from me personally. 2.5/5', "Well the last season may not be strong as the last three seasons, but it does has some moments like the fight action scenes and some good moments, and even with some new twists like the monster globgor was such a sweet guy after eclipsa becomes his love and a husband, and mina turns out to be a bad guy cause her mind was solarian magic was the result when it goes to far, not to mention that this has nothing to do with the fandom shipping the show itself, the show itself doesn't get ideas from fans themselves, the reason is that the characters are trying to hide their feelings each other in fear that it would interfere with friendship, and they date other people so they can put it behind them, but it didn't last long, so it kinda like can you feel the love tonight song like love is actually there and the couple doesn't even know if they're ready for it, and it kinda works well when the two can't hide their feelings for each other every time, sure they don't want to do it, but it's their love for each is so strong and it is impossible to ignore it and the only way they can resolve it is expressing each other, and love is so strong that it merge the wol rods because of their love. the people who were being salty about it needs to get a life and needs to understand that the last season is not terrible, it's like they're missing and they're even worse than toxic voltron fans. So overall, the last season isn't big like season three, but it was a thrilling ride and a big wrap up for the show and we will never forget the adventures in mewni. So this is a good season after all.", "Though the show's epic final season has moments where the relationship drama and fillers get strained, it still wraps up it's impressive overall plot in a neat magical bow.", 'Pretty much throws away what the past seasons were constructing, and ends it in a mediocre way that has no sense of satisfaction whatsoever.', 'Acredito que a melhor forma de dar minha opinião é respondendo as críticas dos demais. Pelo que vejo a maioria das pessoas que criticaram essa temporada não entenderam pontos cruciais da trama. Eu compreendo que desde a terceira temporada o desenho já tinha uma tendência de apelar para questões sociais fora do universo da série (fazendo episódios inteiros para analogias com problemas sociais do mundo real), e sim concordo que isso é algo ruim, isso quebra a imersão do telespectador na história, contudo discordo que isso seja algo significativo, é apenas um detalhes incômodo. Sobre as reclamações de romance adolescente e desleixo com personagens segundários, creio que esses críticos não compreenderam que a história é sobre a adolescência da Star, se voltarem no primeiro episódio inclusive vão ver que a Star começa narrando, não faz sentido os personagens de segundo planos serem deixados de lado no final e toda atenção ser focada no romance dela com o Marcos, se ela amava ele e tudo estava uma bagunça era óbvio que ela só ia focar nele, e como é a história dela do ponto de vista dela, se ela estava focada nele logo os episódios focariam na relação dos dois, quem reclama disso é por que não prestou atenção.
Outra crítica que eu tenho certeza que a pessoa não prestou atenção é em relação a Star ter causado a morte de vários seres e da Rainha Moon ser extremamente racista com os monstros, olha eu sugiro que revejam o desenho, a rainha Moon perdeu a mãe na adolescência em uma emboscada dos monstros, e depois disso guerreou boa parte da vida, é óbvio que ela vai ser preconceituosa, o mundo dela está em uma paz armada tem pouquíssimo tempo, ela perdeu muita gente na guerra, o estranho mesmo é ela ser tão compreensível, no mundo real as pessoas são muito piores que aquilo por motivos menores, e não posso deixar de falar da reclamação da Star ter matado tantos seres, sinceramente eu acredito que quem comentou isso não prestou atenção, o desenho é feito no formato para crianças e conta do ponto de vista da Star que é basicamente uma criança, mas se analisarem os detalhes, aquele mundo é mais sangrento que Game of Thrones kkkkkkk, quando a Star vai pedir ajuda dos pombos, é feito uma ironia no final, "você não viu os corpos pelo castelo enquanto corria?", e se voltarem as cenas e prestar atenção da pra ver que tem muito corpo, outro episódio é quando o Sapo Musculoso e a Rainha Moon discutem sobre quem comia/destruia os bebês de quem, e nos episódios posteriores fica subentendido que os dois falavam a verdade, e claro se prestar atenção verá que a expectativa de vida das rainhas é extremamente curta e que elas frequentemente tomam atitudes em nome do bem maior, a decisão da Star não foi maluca, e ninguém acharia estranho, naquele mundo, naquele universo, esse tipo de coisa é extremamente normal.

Enfim, creio que da para perceber que do meu ponto de vista a quarta temporada é boa, tem seus erros, alguns incômodos, mas de forma geral ela finaliza de forma incrível, muitas coisas ficam em aberto, a maioria é respondida nos livros do desenho, compreendo que a Disney não permitiu mais do que quatro temporadas, mas mesmo assim a quarta temporada finaliza de forma ideal, fica claro o amor dos dois, assim como o fato de que as aventuras não acabaram, mostra o amadurecimento da Star no ápice, assim como o amor dois que de fato era verdadeiro, em resumo, os pontos principais foram finalizados e bem finalizados, tudo fez sentido se prestarmos atenção naquele mundo.', 'Too much of it was spent on mindless shipping and time wasting and then the actual plot was too rushed to be any good. It had great potential but there was no foreshadowing or hinting and too many characters have 180 turns in their personalities without any hinting, throwing away any character development and a terrible ending which is fine until you stop and think about it.', "It was incredibly painful to watch such a great show fall from grace. This season replaced the funny, charming, and relatable elements the show once had with lots of unrealistic teen romance drama and a boring racism plot. The background characters, who were once filled with personality, are now mindlessly racist for the sake of a long, uniteresting plot about racism. Other side characters, like Rhombulus and Moon, were now lame villains for this racism plot. Plus, the final villain is the worst villain of the show. Mina Loveberry is such a boring villain, who isn't intimidating in the slightest. The writers could have made her a better villain by exploring her backstory a bit more, but decided not to and to instead focus on teen romance. The romance this season was done horribly, as characters got together and broke up for no reason other than the writers desire for Starco. The best characters were seriously underused, and the main characters became genuinely unlikable.", 'Although it seemed a bit rushed at times, likely due to the creators trying to tie up plots before the ending, the final few episodes tied together most points and the finale left me satisfied and heartbroken to see it ending.', "Last episode meh but it's good", "This season was an incredibly disapointing end to one of my favorite shows ever. The whole thing feels rushed and plot points from previous seasons are just thrown out the window for new badly built plot points that just help to drag the show down. The creators of the show seemed to just shove any good plot out the window in favour of 'starco' which in the end dosent really work that well as its just thrown in out faces in favour of the relationships that are actually built up over time and work well. Characters who we have gotten a connection to in previous seasons are just thrown down the drain for no apparent reason in favour of making a mess of a 'plot'. And star in the end even commits multi-dimensional genocide WITH NO CONSEQUENCES FOR HER. Its just blown of that it is fine that she killed trillions of species and that she should be happy. Also they just forgot about toffee in favour of mina for some reason.

In the end I am really dissapointed and I do not recommend that you watch this season as it will just drag down everything from the previous seasons and leave you with a bad taste in your mouth.", 'An incredible season, a lot of drama and romance, I love that they have done this, although it had some failures, I could not help enjoying and waiting for the next episode, a beautiful but open ending, which leaves you wanting more. It will always be my favorite animated show, thanks to the entire cast for the love of this show.', "I found this season to be different, not bad but different, and in many ways it was the most mature and disturbing season yet. There weren't the usual magical super villains but rather normal people and loved ones falling into villainy due to their ignorance and bigotry, and through their racism Mewnie devolves into inter-factional civil war. Their were hints at genocide through ethnic cleansing. (I have a background in history and global studies so what was clear as day for me may not be for everyone.)

Of course the narrative was not as apocalyptically dark as I made it out to be. There are a bunch of comedic episodes (I wouldn't call them filler though). But the overall narrative was that of a world descending inexorably towards ethnic strife, despite Marco and Star's increasingly desperate efforts. 

The ending, however, was fabulous and made me quite happy.", "I don't know what happened with this season, oh wait I do! This season put mediocre teen drama and filler episodes over finishing the story, the finale still had more questions unanswered than answered, and most of the episodes are awful to pretty good when other seasons did so much better, an awful ending to this season, and why did they remove the continuity checker in the last 8 episodes or so, it turned out to be one giant mess.", 'Season 4 of "Star vs. The forces of evil" isn't as good as season 3. It still is a satisfying conclusion to one of my favorite shows.', "I'm so sad it's over 😢", "Well I'm really saddened to see this show ending but sure everyone didn't like the ending...but I do. Sure it was quickly paced but although the plot is really interesting. And I have enjoyed the Starco kiss", "Although I still preferred the first and second seasons of this show about a magical princess from an alternate dimension, season 4 is a suitable finale to the show.

The best thing this season does is correct the weaknesses of the last one. When Star (voiced by The Middle's Eden Sher) moved back to Mewni from Earth, the show lost some energy , The Mewni storylines weren't as interesting. The writers course corrected here and I found myself entertained again. (The opening is a little weak. You spend an episode and a half with a bunch of one-note characters called the Pie Folk who are basically somewhat uncomfortable Romani (Gypsy) stereotypes). A lot more focus is on the monster/Mewman social and racial dynamics here and it really pays off. It serves as a really nuanced way to teach children about the dangers of and dealing with racism. All the previous elements of world building come together here. The ending to the show is really something.

This season focuses a lot more on the assorted cast rather than just Star, which helped a lot since they were losing steam on what to do with her. Star's dark and weird stuff-loving friend from Earth Janna (Abby Elliott) is a lot better incorporated in this season. However, fans of Ludo {Alan Tudyk), who was once a regular and the main villain, will be disappointed to see him basically get one episode. Though, he does get a proper wrap-up.

The last season felt a little too story heavy. This one focuses more on the humor. Plus, the dimension-hopping is back, which I missed.

Overall, the show doesn't have quite the same comic energy as it started out with, but I am still impressed with the storytelling here.", 'Filled with pacing issues, a bad ending, and even a hint of sequelitus, Star Vs may come to a disappointing finale, but can still be considered a fun watch for fans of the previous seasons.', '2nd favourite season after the 3rd
Amazing work and fantastic finale !!!', "The worst season of the series. It started fine, but after the second half, the writing became so flawed that it was impossible not to notice it. I'm not even sure how people that came up with such good things in the past could think this was a good way to end the entire show.", 'Weakest season, not worth watching. Felt so forced. Sad it will end with everything being a huge mess.', 'its overtaking gravity falls', 'This season has brought with it a hyped climax and one that will surely pay off', 'By far the best season']

If anyone knows how to give something zero stars, please let me know. Because this show does not deserve half a star", "Currently in the middle of the great pandemic of 2020 and this is the best new show on TV.  It's got heart, action, and is family friendly.  Definitely check it out if you haven't already."]

Review_audience:
['WHAT A SHOW AMAZING ITS AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! JUST LOVED THE WAY OMNI MAN HAS BEEN SHOWN IN THIS SHOW JUST CAN NOT WAIT FOR ITS SEASON 2 A MUST WATCH FOR A sci-fi lover and a superhero nerd like me .', 'I loved this series it was entertaining, gory, and action pack.', "This is a must see for all. I don't normally like twist villains but omni-man is done to perfection and the fights are absolutely breath taking. The side character get enough screen time for them to be likeable but not enough for them to be annoying and the other villains such as the mauler twins are very entertaining to watch and they are original which is what I like about invincible, its original. 5/5 I would recommend to everyone", 'First half an episode was a bit roapy. Then boy did it take off. Excellent', 'Beautiful watch, it is peak', 'A perfect adaptation of a perfect comic.', "the whole show is so heavy! gives the boys' vibes.", 'This is like the boys with way less political commentary.', 'Invincible couples fantastic writing with convincing performances, but the show's persistent edginess risks a parade of cringy self-seriousness. It's clear that Amazon aimed at a college-age demographic; those who'd lap up the subversion of genre conventions, the over-indulgent gore, and the wayward moodiness of young-adult life. Taken with "The Boys", Amazon's strategy to claim their corner of the superhero market is becoming increasingly transparent.  Fortunately, this atmosphere of pseudo-profundity is frequently upstaged by some of the best storytelling to come out of the superhero genre of late.', 'This series was a good twist from the normal action hero genre.  A lot of the events are unpredictable and they must leave cliff hangers because I binge watched this in 2 sittings.  Very good!

 Looking forward to Season 2.', "This was everything dc couldn't be!! Fantastic show", 'I saw the fight scene from the end of the first episode in a Youtube video and came to the show looking for more of that. I was subsequently disappointed, since none of the other action could even compare to that scene. And the action is sparse, only sprinkled on top of the teen drama and the "tune in next time"-style mystery that this show offers.', "amazing, can't wait for season 2. Steven Yeun's best work since he left The Walking Dead.", "Epicly Insane!
It was funny,emotional,blooddy stastifying with gore and action and the animation is top tier with an awesome soundtrack, each and every character was amazingly developed and the teenage stuff was fun, the story and the twists specially the 1st episode's it was surprising and the ending it was cold and satisfying,Overall its an epic Masterpiece!", "One of those over the top gore action cartoons, but with a twist. These are all rip-offs of known super heroes done with no shame. I enjoyed the first season, and I'm looking forward to the second.", 'This is a brilliant show, highly recommend.', 'What is it with Amazon and Comics, The Boys is awesome as is this animated take on Invincible.', "Invincible is a great show that is set in earth that is filled with super hero's and villains. The show follows a kid named invincible who's dad is Omni-Man, the greatest superhero in the world. In the first episode Omni-Man kills every member of the guardians of the globe, which was a group of superheroes like the adventures, and it is not revealed why he did this until the end. This does a great job a setting up Omni-Man as the villain with this seemingly senseless act of violence. The other characters in this show don't know that Omni-Man is evil which creates a ton of suspense when he is in the scenes. When invincible started training with his dad, it makes you horrified because what Omni-Man is capable of doing to him. This continues throughout the entire show and it creates a masive payoff when Omni-Man and invincible finally fight. It is revealed that Omni-Man never cared about earth or its people, he was on earth for the sole purpose of helping his people take control of earth. He shows that he doesn't feel anything for the human race by killing hundreds of humans for no reason. Omni-Man is obviously stronger and shows this by beating his son nearly to death, but when he wins but is unable to kill his son and this shows that he has some humanity. The reasons I love this show is it's good animation, complex characters, unexpected twist along with good story telling, and finally it is one of the few shows that when I started watching it was nearly impossible to stop.", "Unfortunately, there isn't much to say about the series, as almost everything is a spolier. I'll just say this: the series is absolutely fantastic. Go watch the series now!", 'Stellar, top drawer superhero show alongside the likes of The Boys, Daredevil, and the Disney+ MCU first wave.']
Review_critics: ['Falling in love with this violent, funny and emotional superhero story is... inevitable!', 'Game of Thrones for the superhero genre.', "I am sure they want to find The Boys-style success here with a somewhat similar concept, given that the series is their most prominent original by far, and they're certainly off to a good start.", 'This is a great opening, birthing a new superhero series primed for Amazon.', 'Invincible has the potential to become a better show, but only if the makers move beyond this adolescent mockery of a superhero series and into a zone of mature storytelling. The ingredients are already there. The mixing needs to be better.', 'Invincible is the current, leading guilty pleasure for any self-respecting comic book fan.', 'If you are from the The Boys, or The Umbrella Academy school of anti-hero shows, you will find yourself exponentially rewarded with the time invested.', 'Rather than relying solely on shock value, Invincible feels "adult" in the more minor considerations of its characters.', 'Rest assured, this is so much more than just another superhero cartoon. No, this is humor, mystery, drama, romance and science fiction, all rolled up into one absolutely addictive treat.', 'This lurid animated series combines the levity of a classic coming-of-age comedy with the trend of increasingly gritty superhero dramas.', 'It may not have the spectacle of a grand, VFX-embellished live-action entertainer to show off, but this little show does manage to hold its own nonetheless.', "With its fun '80s-inspired animation style and stellar voice cast, Invincible is worth checking out for superhero genre fans. That said, it offers very little that we haven't seen before.", "It's a very smart show, even if it's a bit too soon to tell if its many characters and elements will come together satisfactorily. With incredible talent behind it, Invincible is off to a very strong start.", 'It\'s hard to see exactly what "Invincible" wants to say with its expectation-shattering ethos, but it\'s certainly earns your attention.', 'The old-school animation, married with deep character work and a thoughtful plot that sticks with you, make the series stand out proudly among the comic book crowd.', 'Not even Smallville could combine YA drama and superhero DNA this well.', "If all of Kirkman's upcoming shows are like this - we can't wait.", 'Invincible captures all the heart, humor, and brutality fans expect from the comics while still being open to new audiences.', 'Anyone who loves superheroes in any shape or form will want to add this series to their viewing list.', "Invincible is not for sensitive stomachs and, happily, it doesn't want to be. [Full Review in Spanish]", 'The human dimension is the great difference between this series and any other product emanating from the world of superheroes. [Full Review in Spanish]', "Invincible's first season was great fun, full of both drama and humour, and an impressive voice cast only adds to the show's quality. Recommended.", 'One of the best superhero series out there. [Full Review in Spanish]', "Invincible may not be the most original superhero story, but it's a damn good one - fun, compelling, and with a hell of a voice cast, it's worth your time.", 'Invincible takes all the superhero tropes out there and turns them on its head, with a Mystery drama that combines the anxiety of the teenage world with ultra-violence and a dark sense of humor.', "The fights are exciting, the animation's top-notch, but that's just the icing on the cake. Deep down, it is great, grade-A, solid, relatable, interesting character storytelling.", 'Replete with a solid score and many sequences of character development, Invincible relishes action sequences and character interactions as much as it does explicit gore, all with a wicked sense of humor.', "I'm definitely inclined to keep watching. But the producers will have to work hard to ensure that the 40- to 45-minute episodes (the same length as an hourlong TV show with commercials) don't start to feel bloated.", "A dark superhero series with similar beats you've seen before if you love the genre. The main drawback is that some of the main characters are not interesting enough to hold your attention like they should.", "With a great voice cast led by Oscar nominee Steven Yeun, this animated series does justice to Robert Kirkman's superhero comics.", 'Invincible is at turns exhilarating, fun, unsettling, creepy, and disturbing -- everything you want from an action-adventure story. Take a flyer on it.', "From its slick animation to its excellent voice cast, it's a winner from top to bottom.", "Superhero fans will probably enjoy the many hat tips to classic superheroes, and although the subversion of tropes may feel less surprising than they did back in the day, it'll still pack a punch for comic and superhero fans alike.", "Much like Amazon's massive superhero hit The Boys, it incorporates the iconography and character archetypes of more popular properties to give viewers something that still feels familiar and inviting.", 'Invincible is not only bold, brash and broad in scope, but has the ability to draw pathos from its smallest moments.', 'What if Spider-Man came out today, and it was very violent? The result is a fun yet dark show about the cost of being a teenage superhero.', "Despite the frequent spattering of blood, Invincible doesn't otherwise aim to be lurid for the sake of it. Instead, it's got a story with nuance and heart.", "'Invincible' is ridiculously violent, but at the center of its superhero satire is a coming of age story surprisingly full of heart.", "Some of the series' devices now seem less fresh than they did in 2003... but the show combats this by devoting serious screen time to building out the dynamics between its characters in ways big and small.", 'But both the jokes and the character beats that fuel Invincible are too sporadic to make the series feel anything more than sputtering. Unassailable, it is not.', "A big part of Invincible's charm is in the way it has little use for most of the traditional sources of drama in superhero storytelling.", "There's likely going to be at least some of part of Invincible that piques your interest. But it's too early to say whether the whole season will pull together into something greater than its many parts.", "It's well written and the animation style is retro-cool.", "Three episodes in, Invincible's a competent (and very close) adaptation conveyed by competent animation. However, the strength of the voicework suggests the show can offer increasingly more interesting stories as the season goes on.", 'Once the initial face-punch of that first episode wears off, there\'s not enough powering (or superpowering) "Invincible."', "Amazon's new animated series goes through familiar superhero motions, but its well-crafted and jaw-dropping twist will keep you engaged.", "Assuming there's no major deviation, Invincible might be the most faithful from comic to TV adaptation ever.", 'This series has so much heart, but it balances that with brutal moments that fans will never forget.', "Indeed, streaming is awash in such fare... That sense of familiarity doesn't necessarily undermine Invincible on its merits, but it does make the exercise unavoidably feel a bit been there, seen that.", "...it's nice to see at least one superhero property at least trying to capture the full spectrum of what makes us so annoyingly obsessed with them.", "Invincible is okay. As a piece of early 2000s nostalgia, it's fun enough, but it's just too dated, too cliche, and almost a bit too earnest to stand out in an entertainment landscape already packed with superhero entertainment.", 'I was impressed with how well it represents the classic spirit of the genre while simultaneously exceeding expectations, accommodating modern sensibilities without sacrificing personality. [Full Review in Spanish]', 'Edgy, fresh & thrilling, Invincible actually manages to stand out in the very crowded superhero space. Voice cast is particularly strong, great to see Steven Yeun as lead.', 'As an animated entry presented as seriously as necessary while maintaining a grand sense of humor, Invincible has plenty to offer and is just getting started.', 'What both anchors and keeps Invincible compelling is its cast, packed to the brim with talent. As Mark, Yeun conveys a perfect combination of teenage insecurity, determination and occasional arrogance.', 'This is everything I wanted The Boys series to be. An incisive, unblinking, shocking, and bloody look at the downside of superheroes and it has jokes too. I cannot wait to inhale the rest of the series', 'The end result is bewildering, but also exhilarating, injecting energy into a simple power fantasy premise even as it carries the potential to alienate viewers looking for lighter fare.', 'Like a good superhero comic, Invincible understands the value of unexpected twists and cliffhangers. And, like any comic hoping to keep its audience, it knows the value of getting off to a strong start.', "For now, we'll simply say that Invincible is one of the best new shows for genre fans and a worthy addition to the oversaturated superhero market.", "One of the best things about Invincible, though, is its stellar voice performances. While a lot of major characters get a chance to shine in the first three episodes, Steven Yeun's turn as Mark Grayson is particularly noteworthy.", "While the first three episodes made available for review don't quite sell the idea that Invincible has much new to bring to the genre, they will certainly speak to longstanding fans who've been waiting for this adaptation for years.", 'I think Amazon has something great on their hands. [Full review in Spanish]', 'Quite a credible family dynamic is created for a cartoon, not to mention one with demon detectives and bickering blue bad guys.', 'Invincible boasts one of the most impressive voice casts of any series in recent memory.', "It's not an entirely new approach for this genre, but the familiarity of Invincible is forgivable in light of the confidence that both Kirkman and Yeun bring to the material. They're the reason to watch.", "The more extreme content can feel like Invincible is trying too hard to seem older, just in a different way from its title character. Still, it's fun, and Yeun, Simmons, and Oh make for a strong central ensemble.", "A faithful, epic, violent and wildly fun adaptation of Robert Kirkman's comic.", 'Invincible is brutally violent, darkly comedic, and is one of the greatest animated superhero shows to be released. From beginning to its final moments Episode 1 sets the bar.', "There are still some good bones to its premise, and just enough subversiveness to let you ignore the fact this is a story you've seen a hundred times before.", 'These first episodes are a great primer for the series with good animation, good characters, and solid twists and turns.', "This superhero show may play it a bit safer than The Boys, which won't help it stand out in the current landscape of superhero content, but for now, it works and should satisfy fans of the comic, even if it doesn't reinvent the wheel.", 'Invincible is a truly gigantic story encompassing a ton of characters and subplots, and with hope the show will be able to achieve that same sense of scope.', "Invincible has so much heart and meaning behind those punches that the show leaves an impact even when it isn't throwing blood and severed limbs in your face.", 'Every single frame of this beautifully animated series is just down right stupendous...', 'Totally worth checking out... especially if you want a different look at what it means to be a superhero and what can come of it.', "Its characters aren't developed enough to fill the enormous gap between approach and appearance. However, its central mystery offers enough questions, and enough promise, to keep viewers watching.", "While it might seem like the dark superhero trend is overdone, 'Invincible' is exciting, beautifully animated, and buoyed by a killer voice cast led by Steven Yeun.", 'Balls to the wall action combined with a stellar voice cast make Invincible a must-watch new animated series, even if comic book fans will find much of what plays out on screen to be somewhat familiar.', "Five minutes into its first episode, you'd be forgiven for thinking Invincible is just another superhero story, but in fact, it might be the best one you see all year.", 'Fans of the comics will be instantly hooked -- and those that know nothing about them? They will be hooked too!', 'The animated series delights in the pleasure that superheroes must feel when wielding their powers.']

Review_critics: ['Lizzie McGuire is still one of the most well-known and well-loved series from the Disney Channel, and for good reason. Lizzie was the everyman -- she was all of us, and we identified with her hard.', 'What I consider the best Disney Channel original program ever, Lizzie dealt with a myriad of middle school problems.', 'There is no denying the magnitude of this one... While the show itself was a classic (but not without its problematic scenes), what came from it was even better.', 'It seems silly to think that a Disney Channel show about an average, adolescent girl could have been powerful enough to leave you with a memory that you carry 12 years after the show... However, I do.', "We get the adorable beginnings of Lizzie and Gordo's budding romance."]

title: Marvel's Hero Project
plot: This 20-episode series shares the remarkable, positive change several young heroes are making in their own communities across the country. These inspiring kids have dedicated their lives to...
actors: Jordan Reeves, Daniella Benitez, Elijah Lee, Camron Reeves
Review_audience: ['An inspiring masterpiece of a series', "What a fantastic series!  These young real life heroes offer hope for the future of our society.  Can't get enough of these stories.  Hope they do a second season.", 'Love these kids! Let the good tears flow!', 'One of the best new originals on Disney+.', "How refreshing to find a show that celebrates our youth in a positive light, each one making a difference in their own way. With all the negativity in the world today, it's nice to have hope for the next  generation- keep the stories coming!!", 'Fantastic, heartwarming story to watch as I kick off a new year and new decade!!', 'Keep it up Marvel! This is exactly what kids and adults need to be watching. So inspired by these amazing little humans.', 'Marvel really has lost their way with sjw nonsense.', "Marvel's Hero Project is the uplifting and inspiring show we all need right now! It's honestly perfect, and you can tell that Marvel takes great care in highlighting the heroes making a difference in our world.", 'This show was incredible! Very emotionally uplifting and inspiring. As a big marvel fan, it was great to see how they brought the universe to life for these amazing kids. Each hero is portrayed very authentically, and their genuineness shines through the screen. I really hope they make a second season!!', "This show is a must watch, the heartwarming stories are shared so well and each Hero's personality shines through beautiful. Awesome show!!! Hope they do a second season!", 'Inspirational and warmed my soul.', 'Amazing and inspirational show! We finally found a show that the whole family loves.', 'Well made inspirational TV!', 'So inspiring!!! Such a beacon of light to combat all the negativity we see daily in the world today.']
Review_critics: ["Marvel's Hero Project is an uplifting and inspiring show for all the family, celebrating the amazing achievements of phenomenal real-life heroes.", 'While the Marvel branding threatens to overpower, the stories on each episode are strong enough to stand alone.', "But while the series isn't as prominent as The Mandalorian or Falcon and the Winter Soldier, it is a wholesome, charming show grounded in the real change that a spectacular kid can make.", "Marvel's Hero Project is exactly the kind of show we need right now: a wonderful fountain of positivity that acts as a perfect palate cleanser amid all the negativity of the world.", "Hero Project's best attribute is that it lets the kids being profiled shine through.", 'The real-world stories are inspiring enough. The framing device, in which the word "Marvel" is pronounced as often as is (slightly more than) seemly, is a distraction that feels like self-promotion.', 'Marvel celebrates the young superheroes walking among us.', 'These human-interest stories are undeniably powerful at times, and the series is reasonably well-made.', "It's not entirely suited for a 30 minute format, and you can often feel the strain, but it's never not uplifting.", "While [it] doesn't include the kind of superheroes we're used to seeing battle bad guys on the big screen, the series could motivate both kids and adults struggling with problems in their lives and communities to start working toward solutions.", 'A show easily putting a smile on anyone, reminding us of the immense impact that heroes have in our lives, whether in comic pages or real life. [Full Review in Spanish]', 'Talk about inspiring - this show proves that not all heroes wear capes. Truly powerful and a must watch for the whole family.', "The bulk of the episode then focuses on the youngsters and their support groups. This is where the true heroism of their story comes through and where you'll feel your heart melt a little more, each and every time."]
