Review_audience:
['Not as good as the previous season but still one of the greatest things out of star wars. I love this show and especially the finale of this season giving star wars fans what they have wanted for years.', 'peak starwars. 
no fillers just action, good story and delivers every time :)', 'Once again The Mandalorian is by far the best Disney+ show. Season 1 and Season 2 are awesome! 9.5/10', 'Continues to be ok nothing really special', 'Very good, good setting good story 👍', 'Not as good as the first season, but leagues better than Boba Fett & Kenobi combined.', 'Hours of pointless side quests, letting you just enjoy some humble Star Wars in-between big events, that are sometimes extremely well executed', 'They did it. They either lost trust (for whatever reason) in their original character and concept (familiar, but NEW) or they thought it would be a good idea to shovel in every know character they have, so they can benefit from each other. Either way, it hurts the show. I have to admit that they add them in quite well, they don't feel out of place by their own, but the sheer amount of already known (and "universe changing") characters make the entire franchise seem small again. Mando (Din Djarin) is a temporarily side character or at least second lead in half the episodes because the focus is on giving the old, already known character enough screen time, things to looks cool with or translations stories to make you want to watch their next spin-off...
It's back on fan service and "wouldn't it be cool" scenes and the writing is all about getting there... it's a shame and boring to watch

 Mando 2.5 (BoBF episodes): 
The episodes were fine, but how thought it would be a good idea to not show Djarins character development (to fall back into his old brutal headhunter mode and the realisation that he needs Grogu back) and to just go back to normal? What a waste. And the new ship is cool, but lack story telling ability. Now he can out run every threat and transport nothing and nobody. Wow how interesting...', "Great season. The finale is incredible...one of the best things I've seen in a long time. A must see for all Star Wars fans.", 'Very good-looking, the plot is developed according to the history of Star Wars, and the freshness is also very high~', 'Star Wars + Firefly = Awesome!', 'Still just as great to watch', 'A great sequence to the story. Full of surprises.', 'Season 2 was better than season 1.  There were 1 or 2 boring episodes, and the last episode would have been more intense if the Dark troopers were 100% robots (some sort of cyborg would have been better), but I kind of understand how they had to be droids after the way Luke destroyed them all (since it is a family show after all).  Overall, great job, good acting, great characters and fantastic to see Luke as a not a wasted has been.', 'Getting a look into the state of Mandalorian culture, divided tribes believing other Mandalorians are not real Mandalorians, and of course the amazing ending with the brilliant looking CGI Luke gave a sense of nostalgia', 'Building on what made the previous season great. Lacking at the end because of excessive fan service. I was really hoping for Mandalorian to break free of the burdens of the original saga, instead they connect it more and more to characters that have seen their best before date pass.', 'Like in season 1, this show kept the writing tight. The Mandalorian continues to provide solid Star Wars content in season 2.', 'The second season of The Mandalorian somehow improves on the first.', 'The best thing star wars has produced they really get the feeling.', "I didn't think it was possible to top the first series, but I was wrong. The best Star Wars since Empire and probably the best thing on TV this century. Awesome.", 'Kyle Dunnigan playing Luke Skywalker was incredible!', 'An amazing 2nd season. Highs, lows, fascinating comeback with incredible visuals and storyline.', 'Not as good as season 1', 'A story about resilience, loyalty and following the force. A tribute to Star Wars fans.', 'Best thing to come out of Disney for star wars. Also baby yoda x', "Season 2 was stagnant the story didn't evolve. We just had Mando doing side quests as Grogu... which is fine but it gets tiring after a while. A lot of the shows were Cameos to set up future shows (Boba and Ahsoka for example). 

It felt more like a advertisement more than a show per se. 

Loved Luke Skywalker showing up at the end as the extremely powerful Jedi... they did justice to his character after the disaster that was The Last Jedi. My final verdict is an above average show, which you will probably enjoy... but for sure not as much as season 1", 'One of the best series on Disney+', 'Not as good as season 1 but still good enough for 5 stars in my opinion.', 'amazing! loved seeing other people come into the show. they made it natural and it was amazing!', 'Great writing and adventure entire time.', "They should have waited to reveal Pedro's face until the finale when he sees baby Yoda. This would have given that scene more weight and made it all the more epic.", "Season 1 was outstanding, pure Lucas era Star Wars. Season 2 was great, did a lot of world building and sent us to new planets, introduced us to new characters and settings and some old fan-favorites too... Would definitely recommend if you were ever a fan of Rebels, Clone Wars, or Star Wars at any point in time. I'll cap this off by saying #RehireGinaCarano. Cara Dune was one of the best characters on the show and Season 3 will be worse off if she's not a part of it.", 'My Favorite Series of all', 'Again, fantastic. Mandalorian is great asset to Star Wars universe. Fascinating story, everything u love to see.', 'One of my favorite TV experiences ever! This is Star Wars done right! This is the way!', 'disney sets the bar low, but still an enjoyable series if a decline from the first', 'Mediocre story at best. Pedro Pascal taking off his helmet was a terrible choice for numerous reasons.', 'Decent but a pretty big dip in quality from season 1, packed with fan service.', 'The continues to deliver. The integration with the animated series, has been well done. Making the series more tangible as part of Star Wars.', 'If you enjoyed this season, it all got reset in the trash Bobba Fett show. Baby "product placement" is back with Mando.', 'What can I say? Season 2 totally rocks. Love the aliens!! Simply enchanting and entertaining. Great storyline. Solid acting. Windu says he is there to train Grogu as he did back at the temple. Boba and Din do everything to defeat Mace as he tries to explain everything. R2D2 will always be my favourite Star Wars character but Din Djarin is getting very close.  Pedro Pascals performance (along with the stunt guys), make him a compelling watch. Staring from episode 1 I had high expectations for the rest of the season because the first episode was 52 minutes! and it didn't feel rushed and well paced. Episode 2 was alright  like the child was great-ish and it was just generic. Then episode 3 started great with the frog people which I really liked then Bo Katan and her squad come in and... well it gets worse. It felt like they were the "cool kids" and they were pushed to the limit and I sort of hated Bo Katan. Also some of the lines were bad. Episode 4 was actually almost as good as 1. The child was freakin adorable with the cookies! And I just didn't like how season 2 was seeming to have the same formula every episode- The Mandalorian goes somewhere, meets someone, does something with them, then leaves (really?!). Well moving on to episode 5 and you got Ahsoka. That may seem cool at first but I kind of didn't like many of the characters in this episode including Ahsoka. And that final fight was sort of garbage. Episode 6 though was really good. Boba Fett was a straight up BAD A$$ and Fennic was cool too. It was also the only episode where I felt suspense and felt after it ended I needed another episode ASAP. Episode 7 comes along and boy it's almost terrible. Mayfeld (Bill Burr) was very unlikable and it felt like a stupid, laughable, and pointless episode that wasted my time. Episode 8 was a straight up disappointment. I hated how Luke just comes in and freakin copies Darth Vader's hallway sequence, like that is what made him menacing and stand out in Rogue One. It also felt way too rushed by cramming okay action everywhere and the tension was all over the place and it was just a sloppy mess. In conclusion there was way too much fan service that ruined the show a lot and I hope Disney can learn from that. FAN SERVICE ISN'T THE BEST THING.', 'Cream rises to the top. Another unforgettable season.', 'I felt a bit disappointed with the direction this season was taking, until the ending. The filler episodes are tedious to get through. However, the introduction of many beloved fan favorite characters and a tearful finally made everything this season was building towards worth it. Not as good as Season 1, but a welcome addition to the Star Wars canon all the same. 8/10', 'As good as the first season was, this one is better in every way.', 'This second season further explores the greatness that Favreau and FIloni have established within the Star Wars universe, the life of a Madalorian learning to confront and survive the potholes that life presents, in order to overcome them, finally I also managed to vindicate one of the great characters and heroes of the ORIGINAL material, as in truth he is a true Hero in action and fighting for justice in the galaxy, not like the sequels did in ridiculing and intimidating him, very well done so far, hopefully they continue so this has a great future in front.', "Season 2 blew Season 1 out of the water. And that season ender. Oh myyyyy, take control of my ship cause I'm about to faint. Season 3 needs to hurry!", 'Season 2 is as good as season 1.  Good stuff!  Although I am disappointed Gina Carano will not be back...', 'amazing does everything better than the first season', "Please make the action scenes more like rogue one or revenge of the Sith and less like rebels. I get that stormtroopers are bantha fodder but that doesn't mean you have to have the main characters defeat them in cheesy ways.", "I did a season 1 review that contained all my thoughts.

But season 2 is a good or better than the first season. I found it more exciting than the first season and the end of the series as a capstone that couldn't have ended it any better.

Fingers crossed for next season.", "Much better than the first season, the Frog Lady was my favourite. Will miss Gina Carano's Cara Dune, shouldn't have been fired because of her opinions.", 'Besides being better than the first season in almost every aspect, the series takes advantage of the plot arising from the events of the first season to introduce at the end one of the classic Star Wars characters, none other than Luke Skywalker, which besides matching the whole mystery story of the second season, ends up bringing us a brief memory of the first Star Wars movies.', "*THIS REVIEW WILL CONTAIN SPOILERS*

This series is easily the most overrated Star Wars thing to ever churn out of Lucasfilm. The characters all either have no arcs or terrible arcs. The action is really lackluster which is disappointing because usually, the fight choreography in Star Wars movies or shows is very impressive. The acting is mediocre, not bad, just fine I guess, but Pedro Pascal has almost no material to work with because his character has the most wooden, bare-bones personality I've ever witnessed in a Star Wars character. The best aspect of the series is it's soundtrack which is pretty amazing, and visually it's one of the best looking shows ever made.", "The story was well developed from season 1. The main character is brilliant both Mando and Baby Yoda. Mando's character shines so much even with his emotionless armor. We feel the bond of character without many conversations and facial expressions. The theme, the sound, the story promote each other fantastically, making scenes iconic as they should be. In my opinion, the signature of this series is the fascinating pictures in almost every scene. Only to view beautiful pictures are worth the time.", 'this season had amazing moments. made me cry during the season finale', 'Bringing Star wars back to its best', "This new season is much better than the first season, I consider today's biggest sci-fi series", "Season 2 of the Mandalorian comes out guns blazing, reminding us of why we love the Star Wars universe. 

Again, the Mandalorian kills it in the second season, and creates some of the very best episodes yet. Seeing the characters in some new and creative planets is very satisfying and having some classic characters come in is great to see. 

Also, the season finale is absoloutely astounding. They created a satisfying ending while still creating a wonder of what will happen next. Can't wait for another season.", 'One of the best shows on TV at the moment, one of the only reasons to bother with disney+', 'Ainda melhor que a primeira temporada', "It is not particularly revolutionary, nor is its writing particularly impressive, but, as the Saturday morning cartoon style form of weekly entertainment it is trying to be, The Mandalorian's second season works exceptionally well.", 'As someone who has spent 10s of thousands of dollars on Star Wars over the years, I'm obviously devastated by what DISNEY did to the original characters. I don't understand how you get hired to work on something worth $4B that you want to "burn". To me, the Disney Movies can't exist for me to ever enjoy Star Wars again (Rogue One gets a pass)
Loved the Ashoka episode this season, and I cried at the end of The Rescue. Its literally what I've waited 38 years to see. Luke is a Hero, not a Zero. So although I do my best to give Star Wars NO money for any Merch/Movies/Etc (I watched this at a friend's house), I did enjoy this season. But sadly, Disney doesn't want the fans that came with Star Wars. So I'll go. Wonder what the impact to Goodwill was on the Balance Sheet after The Last Jedi.', "This is a dream. I can't say anything else. another perfect season. Why weren't the sequels like this????????? Star wars would feel complete if that happened. And maybe changing TPM and AOTC but that's it.", 'See the difference between the episodes where Gina Carano is and the rest and you will see the contribution that she makes to the franchise, Without Gina there is no Mandalorian', 'This season was even better than the first. We got to see many different characters. We even got back Luke Skywalker and Boba Fett which was an awesome moment. I would really love t see Gina Carano come back to portray as Cara Dune because she was by far one of my favorite characters from this show.', 'sin duda le da un aire nuevo a la franquicia de STAR WARS pero sin faltarle al respeto, e incluso expandiendo el universo y trayendo de vuelta personajes bastante queridos. un producto exquisito para los fans mas acérrimos y absolutamente disfrutable para nuevas audiencias.', "The second season of The Mandalorian is another fine demonstration of how this show is one of the greatest things the Star Wars franchise has to offer with production values that look like they came straight out of the movies, amazing performances, well-composed score featuring both Western-style motifs and John Williams-inspired music as well, amazing action sequences and even a couple of surprises along the way, most notably translating elements introduced in the animated shows for the first time in live-action while still being accessible to people unfamiliar with Clone Wars and/or Rebels. The only downsides? The short runtimes, as with the last season, the X-Files-based decision to have episodes that are part of the continuing story and filler episodes won't appeal to everybody (especially in a day and age where virtually every TV show we see is expected to be a 5-10-hour movie) and, on a more nitpicky side, Baby Yoda's canonical name. Seriously, I know Star Wars wants to give everybody a unique name but, let's not mince words, his official name is hard to take seriously. Overall, this second season of The Mandalorian is another reason why Disney+, for a relatively new streaming service, is a worthy rival for Netflix.", 'Even better than season 1!', 'Even better than the first season!', "This season continues the amazingness that was given in season 1, but has a few moments that aren't as approachable for non-die-hard star wars fans.", 'Una gramaravilla que es un paso adelante confirmando que the mandalorian es una joya maravillosa de la saga', 'Its fantastic!  A pure Star Wars show!', 'This is what the last trilogy should have been like. Brilliant.', 'This second season of Mandalorian is very good and exceptional, there is not a single boring episode, they are all very good and with great adventures, and the best of all was that ending with Luke helping Mando, Grogu and the rest of the Mandalorians , what Jon favreu raised is applauded and hopefully the third is even better.', 'This show has no plot so it's really boring. Baby Yoda wasn't doing it for me. I felt like I was watching a very long cat video on youtube and was supposed to say "Awww" every 15 minutes every time the baby did something cute. But I don't like cats. So it was double boring for me. I wish they'd spent more time developing Mando's character.', "It has been a joy to watch some real Star Wars and the last episode 'The Rescue' had me in tears. I'm not going to spoil the surprise, however, the last ten minutes are the best Star Wars action since 1983 and the 'Return of the Jedi'", "Season 2 of The Mandalorian was better than the 1st season. I love that we got to see Ahsoka Tano and the appearance of Boba Fett. Can't wait for the Boba Fett series. All around great season. 5/5", 'When a universe can expand on its characters like Star Wars you start to worry if things can be over saturated but in the case of Mandalorian things they did well in season 1 were done with precision and excellent in season 2 and bringing a character like Ahsoka Tano into the fold a character that is beloved from a show in the Clone Wars you really have to make sure it is done well but the performance by Dawson is excellent as well the biggest question is how can they continue to build on this with some of the characters from this show getting spin offs', 'Uma serie que sem dúvida é uma das melhores do ano com uma atuação muito boa do Pedro Pascal para o personagem do Mandalorian. E para mim é melhor que anterior com batalhas de sabres de luz, batalhas de naves fantásticas e a invasão ao cruzador da estrela da morte para resgatar a criança no ultimo episódio, nesta serie aparecem muitos personagens icónicos de Star Wars como o Bobba Fett que no último episódio vimos que ele vai ganhar uma serie. e o Luke Skywaker veio buscar o Babby Yoda (Grogu) que quem não chorou ou ficou muito triste quase a chorar nesse momento em que o Babby Yoda vai embora e deixa o Mando com o Luke não é humano. Simplesmente fantástica esta serie!', 'Terrible show, unbelievable that this has good ratings.', 'Could be better but in the dark times of Disney ruining everything its pretty good', "Another god awful piece of Disney Star Wars crap. For every one thing that was good there were 2 or 3 things that just could not happen. All the laws of physics and common sense were broken one scene after another. For every one good acting performance there were 2 or 3 of the worst acting scenes to follow it up. In a world of blasters and lightsabers there should not be a single hand to hand combat taking place. And how many shots are fired at the main characters without a single hit, other than directly to a Mandalorian piece of armor, never once finding a seam. I don't know how many times I saw a person just charge a group of troopers blasting, covering 10 yards of ground to engage hand to hand. And the single biggest UNBELIEVABLE thing to happen was a female going toe to toe with Boba Fett, taking him to a stalemate. A woman, who by the laws of nature have 30 percent less muscle and speed, taking the baddest, most treacherous, most feared bounty hunter in the entire universe to a stalemate. The dude went toe to toe with Darth Vader and some chick can take him. Everyone is so starved for a good star wars story after the abominable movies that anything even half ass seems good. Basically unwatchable. The only way I made it through was because the special effects were decent and 3 or 4 people nailed the acting. For every 30 minutes of show there was 5 minutes of greatness and 25 minutes of agony.", 'Bigger, better, and a whole lot of more action than the first season.', 'brought me back to Star Wars after the massacre of the Sequel Trilogy, only wish it was released around the world at the same time so there were no spoilers from the US before I saw it, excellent series from people who love Star Wars like me', 'Starts slow, but picks up in about the 3rd episode.
Still a marvelous work of art by the compilation of the most talented, capable group of dedicated professional fans. Every choice has a reason behind it, a story, a sensible why. Absolutely admirable art piece.
Its very exciting, and brings the Star Wars universe to a whole new play ground/level with such great scenery, character development, music, special effects, choreography... everything is 100% better than expected, and completely exciting.', 'great! The best ending for an old fan.', 'El fan service, y las conexiones con las películas clásicas son geniales, y la sorpresa del final, creo que nos encantó a todos', 'Sold season. First 2 episodes were average. 3rd episode was brilliant. The 4th and 5th episode was very good. The 6th episode was amazing. The 7th episode was decent. The last one was the best possible way to pay respect to Luke Skywalker', "So if you like terrible fight sceens and bad acting! You will enjoy this crap sandwich! With Gina C.'s bad version of Xena  and sloppy-lazy writting this is Disney putting down the Star Wars dog. Replay value: cut my eyes out but episode 1 of season two was really good! lol", "The Mandalorian's second season saw a sudden improvement compared to its predecessor, with an even larger universe explored and both new and recurring characters appearing. There was more suspense and anticipation, with (correction to my previous review), the best season finale delivered.", 'Star Wars is clearly in good hands.', "Season Two of The Mandalorian is both better and worse than season one. This season is amazing, keeping the great story, great dynamics and interesting characters from season one while also bringing in new and old faces such as Cobb Vanth, Bo-Katan, Ahsoka Tano and later Boba Fett. Season two brings tensions to a new high and the finale of this season is absolutely amazing. The best part of this show still remains to be the performances by the cast, the villain, Moff Gideon and Mando's relationship with Baby Yoda.", 'Great and really enjoy it, hopefully next season it will discuss more about Mandalorian culture', 'Very enjoyable second series.', 'I remember waiting in line in the summer of 1977 to watch the first Star Wars movie and doing the same thing for the next 2 sequels (I was a fan!). So, I pretty much had no choice to see the second trilogy which was the Anakin Skywalker turning into Dart Vader. The 2nd trilogy relied too much on CGI that wasn't yet up to par imo. But as a Gen X and true fan of the Star Wars history/movies, it was a must see.

Then Disney bought out LucasFilm and decided to go in a completely different direction which was going woke and destroying, insult the "Luke Skywalker" character. So, basically, Rian Johnson and Kathleen Kennedy used the biggest movie franchise in history to push their woke narratives and by doing so, they totally brought down the Star Wars franchise and insulted the entire fandom in the process. The only good movie worth seeing during that period of time was "Rogue one a Star Wars story". 

Then a white Knight (Jon Favreau) came along with his "The Mandalorian" tv series which made the fandom say, wait a minute, let's see what this is all about? The first season was great and we could of seen more episodes for my taste. Then came season 2, which again kind of rallied the fandom back to Star Wars and we were curious and wanting more and boy did we sure get it! The 2nd season in itself was great but the last episode was earth shattering and Jon Favreau had his fingers on the pulse of the fandom and gave us what we wanted all along, especially after the third trilogy debacle/destruction by Rian Johnson/Kathleen Kennedy. 

Our hope in Star Wars was renewed and Jon Favreau had our full attention and we wanted more. So, in a nutshell, "The Mandalorian" totally delivered and much more. Favreau also indicated that there was other Star Wars project in the pipeline. All Star Wars fans were ecstatic and ready for more. That's the magic "The Mandalorian" brought back. 

But then, even the greatness of this series and magic touch of Jon Favreau wasn't strong enough to protect the integrity of "The Mandalorian" from the evil touch of Kathleen Kennedy who fired the strongest female lead role of the show in the character of "Cara Dune" played by a real life kick a** true lead woman Gina Carano.  Jon Favreau had said he had big plans for the "Cara Dune" character but even him couldn't save her from the evil that is Kathleen Kennedy. So as fast as the spark from The Mandalorian series brought the fandom back, the same spark was extinguished and we're back to square one and I guess we'll have to see if Favreau and his team can pull a rabbit out of his hat to save "The Mandalorian" from Kathleen Kennedy once more?', 'Thrilling, meaningful, and touching at every turn, The Mandalorian offers a perfect sophomore season that will please old and new fans alike.', "Season 2 was fantastic and the finale was what every Star Wars fan wanted to see since ROTJ and didn't get to see in the awful Disney Sequel Trilogy.", 'The set design is spectacular. I appreciate Pedro and Gina in their respective roles. As others have mentioned, no story arc. Bad writing. Boba Fett is a iconic character and they had some lady kicking his butt. Give me a break. The show just glosses over things. Very little character or back story on people.', 'A great second season. Secondary characters from the first season have a chance to shine, especially in Episode 15. Pedro Pascal gets more facetime and I think he does a good job of showing vulnerability to a tough as nails character. Grogu shows off more abilities but shows a darker side, especially when it comes to his appetite. Eating aliens unfertilized eggs, which is like eating potential children, I didn't find humorous as Jon Favrou intended. The cliffhanger wasn't as intense as the first seasons and I was hoping to see more out of the main villian. Boba Fett's return was a long time overdue! He literally "kicked butt"! Even the reappearance of the Imperial troop transport was welcomed. I had one when I was a kid.
I recommend the second season. I can't recommend Asako's headpiece.', 'For sure better than the first part and for sure not partaking to the drama nominating category!', 'I loved it, it made me love star wars again', 'This is what Star Wars should be ! Stay true to your direction in producing these type of episodes and Star Wars will redeem itself to be epic again ! (Hint movies )', 'A great second season, this season puts the show in another level, also i really enjoyed the way they introduced characters from the films and the animated serie's.
"This is the way" for the saga.', 'Best Star Wars in 35 years.  Epitome of Epic.', 'Star Wars has officially become Star Trek TNG with the Mandalorian.  The seasons have a very slow arch over 8 episodes. The costumes and Star Wars nostalgia is
not enough to overlook the painfully bad dialogue nor the cliche and boring plots.  Shame on you Favreau.', 'Keeps the story interesting throughout and a welcome addition to the star wars universe.', 'Building on and somehow improving on everything the first season did so well, this really was excellent. The main cast deliver as usual, with Pascal gaining rven more character throughout this season as his arc evolves nicely, while Baby Yoda will always be a highlight. Bringing in fresh faces to play fan favourites like Bobba Fett and the AWESOME last episode complete with the great (if still a little uncanny valley-y) reveal, this had it all. I cannot wait to see where the Star Wars universe evolves to next, but with at least 3 seasons spawned out of this one alone, I am excited!', 'The best tv on this year (and that is in a year of The Boys, Umbrella Academy & Doom Patrol which were all excellent) 
Stunning visuals with a real understanding of the subject.. enough Easter eggs for the fans and decent stories for those coming into Star Wars from a casual perspective.
I cannot rate this highly enough', 'For whoever considers themselves a true Star Wars fan and commends this show, you should be ashamed. Bad story telling, mixed with atrocious acting abilities (apart from Giancarlo Esposito), made for a truly awful watch. I will note the CGI and practical effects were commendable, but this is far from the Star Wars that a real fan would enjoy.', 'A must see for sure.  The best Star Wars type show EVER and thank you for saving the Force.  Incredible.', "As much fun as season one. Season 2 continues to bring a smile to my face and I find myself saying '' That is so cool!'' more often.", "It's a refreshingly different Star Wars backstory, immediate connection to the characters, and a season finale that left my jaw on the floor!", "I truly enjoyed & appreciate the star wars thus jon favreau's mandalorian", "This was superb. I have never felt this happy watching a Star Wars production/story in years. By the end of this show I was in the verge of tears. This was not only a great series but a great Star Wars story for the fans. The characters are amazing, the fan service is not forced, the effects are stunning (both practical and digital) and the direction and passion put into this project is something that can't go unrecognized. This is the future of Star Wars. This is the way.", "Great all round, even without the fan service. I didn't know much about Ahsoka before but boy do i like her now that i read and watch more of her.", "Rather worryingly there are people who haven't rated this five stars, mad.  This has everything a Star Wars story needs.
Season 1 starts of with little dialogue and you wonder how it will develop without that to assist the story and without ever seeing the main character's face. Well no need to worry, it is so well done it it pulls it off spectacularly.  The characters work well together and a host of recognisable names and personalities. 
The end of Season 2 is perfect.", "It's a fun Star Wars romp. However, it has some continuity errors, 2D characters, and conclusions that feel rushed. If you're looking for a story in the star wars universe, this is better than most. Don't think too hard and you'll have an okay time.", 'The Mandalorian strengthens in its second season with consistently entertaining episodes that have thrilling action, fleshed out characters, impressive CGI, and a well-told story, all culminating to an exciting, surprising, and satisfying season finale.', "An awesome, fresh, intelligent instalment in the Star Wars universe that I had lost interest in. Season 2 had me back, until... Pablo Hidalgo started attacking fans who loved the finale. I'm done with Star Wars.", 'Lo mejor que vi en este año, muy emocionado quede con el final!', 'Awesome to see Star Wars back on track with great story telling.  The end of this Season of the show was a very welcome conclusion to the Season, and also other story lines from the broader universe.  The final show of the season was epic, and just very happy that this got done so well.', 'Only disappointment is both the episodes and season are very short.  Really want more.', 'This is the best thing to happen to Star Wars since Return of the Jedi. I had pretty much given up on the mess that is currently Star Wars and... This was not only good... It was great. Hit the ball out of the park and completely worth watching.', "episode 16 included the greatest 6 minutes perhaps in Star Wars history...
shows Jon Favreau and Dave Filoni get Star Wars, know what fans want, (and let's hope they can rebuild, or perhaps rewrite out completely what KathK JarJarAbrams and RhianaJ very nearly destroyed).", 'What can I say, season II was awesome, so very good.  Sure, the story is straight-forward with no overarching story arch with some lame bits (I mean, this is a TV series, what do you expect?), but it was a good story.  Personal struggle, growth, love, sacrifice, I felt myself personally vested in the story -- I wanted more!  I felt like I was actually in that galaxy far, far away, unlike episodes VII-IX in their lecturing contemporary political-social idealisms.  And the finale -- Holy midi-chlorians, Qui-Gon Jinn -- the finale!  It brought a tear to my eye.  This is Star Wars, and what Star Wars ought to be!  I really hope Disney continues on this path, and not the path they were taking with the sequel trilogy.  Beautiful visuals, great story, superb acting... TL;DR:  Awesome -- 9/10!', 'This IS Star Wars!! Atleast how it should be. Not one episode disappoints. Every character just feels right at home in that galaxy far far away and you instantly love them. From Mando himself, to the badass Cara Dune and the reformed Greef Karga. Every star wars fan NEEDS to see this show. Jon and Dave keep striking it out of the park with everything they touch.', "I still find myself checking my phone sometimes while I'm watching this. Despite the drama onscreen, I never really feel as if anything really important is going to happen. The visuals are great, but there's a stagey quality that I can't get past. Loved the end of the season for nostalgia reasons, but I'm not sure that's necessarily a good thing.", 'Esta temporada utiliza mucho el fan-service, y esto no significa que sea malo, al contrario, al fin Disney encuentra el elemento que se esperaba desde hace mucho, el cual corresponde a la nostalgia, para ser una serie se realiza con mucho amor, muy buenas actuaciones, elementos técnicos muy bien utilizados, demasiadas sorpresas agradables que hacen que uno desee estar en el cine viendo tan magistral serie de Star Wars.', 'Outstanding!  Both Star Wars fans and those not as connected to SW will enjoy. One of the best shows available on streaming services. Just wish it was a longer season and longer episodes.', 'A little bit slower than the first season, The Mandolorian S2 delivers more Star Wars content that we love but gets a bit bogged down from the constant planet to planet action and no real climax until the final episode.', 'First couple episodes left a bit to be desired, but the plot picks up steam and really hits its stride for an incredible ride the last half of the season. Bold, emotional, and highlighted by character growth for the titular character, this season is not a let-down from the first season.', "I've been a Star Wars fan since the very beginning. I absolutely love the Mandalorian. It is so true to the feeling of the original movie trilogy. It has action and humor and love, interesting droids, great light saber battles, monsters... and a fantastic story line. I have no complaints.", 'Repetitive and almost every episode feels like a filler only 2 too 3 episodes a season that are important', 'The best Star Wars of the new generation out there! The last episode is a MUST-SEE!', "Favreau and Filloni gifted us Star Wars with season 1 of Mando and then blew the doors off in season 2 with just beautiful story telling... great action sequences and hope for the future of the galaxy far far away. I mean the fan service is engineered so well that it's pivotal to the very last scene. No cheap thrills all big pay offs. The actors all turn in amazing performances including the ones that are only in a few episodes. That is the beauty behind this series every side character lands. Bill Burr is the perfect example or even Timothy Olyphant... must watch for even non Star Wars fans.", "This series is taking back what the sequel movies tore down. So far it's really been giving the Star Wars feeling remembered from the original trilogy.", 'A 55 year old man A New Hope again. It only took 8 years for Disney to figure to stop ruining what made Star Wars great: THE FANS.', 'One of my favorite new shows !!! Excellent McManus wait for season 3', "The mandalorian saga it's better than Star Wars himself", 'Best show on TV hands down. Simple but ground storyline and compelling characters really make Mando stand out. Baby Yoda is the cherry on top but a very big cherry with his cute little self. This show alone puts the entire sequel trilogy to shame. Simple adventures of Mando and Baby Yoda, even without much story progress, are entertaining and crowd pleasing to both hardcore and casual Star Wars fans. Love this show, very emotional and well directed. This is the way to create a successful live action show from a popular franchise.', "Now that's how to end a serie/season - wow 💫", 'Baby Yoda is the cutest of all!', 'Seems like a great new direction for adult audiences.
Simply enjoyable to watch.', 'They should spin at least 5 shows out of this one... f***ing amazing!', 'This is what I wanted from Star Wars in the latest Trilogy.  This show has given me the feeling that all that time of my youth in amazement of Luke and Vader and Han and Leia and all the cool places in the galaxy were not wasted.  What a testament to how someone with a realistic vision could make it fit so well in the Star Wars galaxy.  Better than the last three movies for me.', "It's a well done season, easy to watch, mostly well written and acted. There's just this feeling that this whole second season has been made, following the success of the first one, just to please the public disappointed for the latest three Star Wars movies. It's a nice watch indeed.", 'The best Star Wars since the original series and Rogue One.', 'The special effects here are on a par with the best Star Wars movies and the plot is solid.   The series reminded me of the best Western series from 1960s TV shows.  This series has been a lot of fun.', 'In many ways, it improves on the last one in terms of visual entertainment and expanding the story like how other shows lack these days.', "Know your audience... that's what exactly the Mandalorian does... it knows it's audience & delivers ... yes it's a space cowboy series of this bounty Hunter with no face (for most part) but at its heart it is a story of a father-son relationship which resonates with people ... & his quest to reunite Grogu with his kind... & how this season leads towards it... & of course it's not just any Jedi who can train Grogu. SPOILER TERRITORY... It had to be Luke Skywalker (Ahsoka declined to train him as he had much fear in him & attachment towards Mando) but Luke had managed to turn Anakin towards the light, so even if Grogu had some fear in him with a master like Luke he would be fine... And of course the season finale tied it all together with leaving plot holes for the next season... & the bad ass Luke that we have been wanting to see for decades have finally come to fruition... him dismantling those dark troopers is epic!!! & then the sad goodbye between our beloved main characters 😭... side note on the r2d2 cameo; I feel like Grogu & r2d2 might already know each other cue the Jedi temple at Coruscant...", 'as good as the first season and i appreciated the fan service in the second season!', 'A stunning ending with amazing content! Especially for its longtime fans', 'Maybe the best Star Wars ever?', 'The Mandalorian é a armadura de Besckar que Star Wars estava precisando.', 'Favreau and Filoni have saved Star Wars, Season 2 was awesome! Episodes vary from one to another in quality etc but that's to be expected for any tv show.", 'What all Star Wars should be.', "The second season of The Mandalorian does not disappoint, and while there's plenty of material here for Star Wars fans to gush over, non-subscribers might find themselves surprised at how much they're enjoying it as well. Like the first season, Favreau and his cronies understand how the Star Wars aesthetic should mesh with both historical and cinematic influence, and there's plenty of nods to westerns and martial arts films here (even a little bit of cyberpunk!). Throughout the eight episodes, The Mandalorian gifts viewers with plenty of eye-widening locations, while also telling a satisfying story that does indeed connect to Star Wars lore. Fan-favorite characters from both the movies and animated series (including Ahsoka Tano, making her live-action debut) show up this season, and while it's undeniably fan-service, one should also recognize that universe-building is a favorable attribute of the franchise. This season also features some of the best action sequences you'll see all year, with plenty of enticing choreography and lots of variety, including one sequence in the premiere that (whether intentionally or not) that should prime people for the upcoming Dune movie. At a time when Star Wars movies seem to be in a limbo period, this first live-action Star Wars tv series is really capturing the series universal appeal in spades!", "Absolutely phenomenal!!! "All in all, The Mandalorian: Season Two continues the episodic-style narrative from its debut season, but with an admittedly more significant focus on developing a central arc. Every single chapter is packed with jaw-dropping action, stunning visuals, and a ridiculously addictive score. I have no words to properly praise the impressive technical attributes that transform this show into such an incredible cinematic experience. Jon Favreau and his team of talented directors all deliver remarkably well-directed episodes, but the storytelling structure needs to be calibrated to avoid some of the filler elements. Despite the more fan-servicey season (which ultimately led to a technically embarrassing, dreadful moment in the finale), its narrative never forces inexplicable plot points, following a consistent and continuously entertaining path that allows for the exciting addition of fan-favorite characters. With Pedro Pascal as the compelling protagonist and The Child as his irresistibly adorable sidekick, I can't wait for season three!"', "BEST FINAL EVER!

It's obvious that creators Jon Favreau and Dave Filoni have taken time and thought each episode through. Each chapter is beautiful in its own way and kept the story going. The characters are written extremely well and the story was thought over from start to finish, unlike the sequel trilogy. Any true Star Wars fan knows that this show is amazing. I'm so excited to see what Lucasfilm has in store for this show along with the many other projects coming soon.", 'Amazing series, phenomenal landscape and VFX', 'It was truly AMAZING!!! 👏', 'I've watched plenty of sci-fi in my life, read plenty of sci-fi, and specifically read and followed Star Wars for years. I've accepted the weaknesses of the prequels, the strength of the original series, and the issue of the sequels.  At the end of the day all any Star Wars fan like myself has ever wanted was an extension of George Lucas's vision. Not a recreation or detour, but an expanded Star Wars universe.
When Disney took the helm our hopes were high.  Here were the resources to progress GL's vision, and what we received seemed rushed and disjunct from the rules of the universe that was laid out over the years, midi-chlorian counts aside.  With so much GL approved content we were told that books and ideas were no longer canon, and I was willing to accept with the hope that the best of the content would be preserved and adapted.
After three sequels, with small signs of hope in between (Rogue One and Solo, which was a great movie with box office numbers harmed by The Last Jedi) I was concerned I would see the last of Star Wars.  
The Mandalorian, with limited light-saber/jedi presence, saved Star Wars. 
If this content continues, with Favreau and Filoni and their teams at the helm, I have "A New Hope" that there will be Star Wars content till the day I die.', "The ‘Star Wars' spin-off on Disney + from Lucasfilm Ltd is back for a second season after making an impressive debut with audiences and critics 
The bounty hunter and his small buddy in the form of Baby Yoda continue their perilous journey together after he goes against orders during a job to deliver him to some sinister individuals 
It's up to both of them to find the child's race and reunite with them 
This Mandalorian also has help from a former storm trooper named Cara Dune and Greef Karga
Last season this hunter found most of his creed destroyed with almost nothing left, but he managed to gain his rocket pack and earn a rite of passage insignia on his armor
but thanks to Dune, a protocol nurse droid and unexpected help this bounty hunter goes on more treks escaping Storm Troopers and many others including Moff Gideon who survived 
Season 2 picks up where Season 1 left off; I like the new color palette with the deep blues whereas last time it was dry-looking and had a decaying feel
more inside references and callbacks to previous Star Wars stories are sprinkled throughout for long-time fans
new dangers here include snow spiders, a sand dragon, other criminals after the child, Dark Trooper droids but also new allies in the form of other hunters, one Kobb Vanth played by Timothy Olyphant, and one in particular Bo-Katan Kryze played by Katee Sackoff who wants her rule back and a weapon taken away 
She informs this main bounty hunter he's a member of The Watch; on their world their goal is to re-establish the Mandalore way even if its seen as a religious zealot cult which would explain why the creeds are so divided
So many of them have been in exile ever since the Empire turned their planet upside down 
next he and the child run back into Cara and Karga, we find out where Cara actually is from then later into Asohka Tano one of the last surviving Jedi from when the Empire first took over
Not only that but we finally learn this child's true name and where it actually came from 
And the return of a familiar face from the old days of the franchise makes his appearance that fans will gush over!
Everybody's got their lines they don't cross until things get messy, is the Mandalore's rule any different from the New Republic or the Empire?, for your own creed do you follow the rest or go your own way?
The finale is a daring rescue attempt of one of their own with not just this bounty hunter but 4 kick ass females too 
This season I'm so glad to say gets better and better with each episode raising the excitement factor plus expanding this universe even further 
The biggest surprise of all though is a familiar face from the original trilogy that makes quite an entrance :) 
I admit I did get a bit misty eyed seeing as how one thing ends and another begins 
The fans will notice familiar touches but also appreciate new threads 
So what further adventures lie ahead for the Mandalorian? I'm gonna bet bigger and better things from the creators at this point because they are on a roll with these side-stories and spinoffs 
Season 2 surpassed my expectations way more and I'm still loving the hell out of this franchise 
It continues to be a rewarding experience for fans old and new", 'Modern Star Wars at its finest', 'Thank you Dave Filoni and Jon Favreau for fixing SW!!!', "My son and I (75 and 53) starting watching this as a joke as we both grew up together with his Brother watching Star Wars, Star Trek, Lord of the Rings series, and then into Avengers. We got hooked after the first episode of season one. I also love Pedro Pascal in literally everything from Narcos to GOT. We love it. Everything about it. We just watched the last episode of season two and now can hardly wait for season 3. Proves that it doesn't have to be a blockbuster costing millions to captivate and mesmerize the audience.", 'Pros: It tightened some storytelling from the first season
Cons: It relied way too much on fan service "Oh cool this episode features X a fan favorite!" rather than telling its own story with compelling lead characters and story. This is especially apparent in the last 15 minutes of the season.', 'Exact Rating: 9.4/10

-Even though I am a woman and a feminist I sometimes find it hard to see how movies and series are now making scenes off women on top. Looking forward to the next season.", "Awesome series!!   Well done from beginning to end..  Can't wait to watch more!", 'John Favreau uses his magic once more to help heal the Star Wars fan base and push the line with classic cinema and intriguing story telling with The Mandalorian season 2.', "It's a good time and better still than the first season.", 'If you like starwars this will make your life complete', 'Another great season of baby yoda and mando.', "The magic returned after the prequels that diminished the power in the force, the force is intense in Disney thanks to Jon and Dave, those% $ # DID IT !!! THANK YOU, it's a good time to be a fan again!", "Why the show has such great ratings eludes me. 
The show itself is not dreadful by any means, it's a good-looking Star Wars show to watch and turn your brain off. 
But that's it. 
The plot itself is weak. 
By following a repetitive structure, you'd expect, like for example shows like X-files do, to build short stories with interesting twists, action or to make you ponder. It's a Sci-fi after all. 
It does not do that. The stories themselves are very predictable, the action consists mostly of battling with mindless goons and the character has a literal invincible plot armor. 
Not only that, but it's also so absurd that makes the whole universe look like a 
caricature. Just a brief example: the main character trashes his ship beyond recognition and it gets repaired in an afternoon by 2 workers. 

Every story has bits like this, where the logic is rushed, but Mandalorian abuses this so much that it discards the science part from Sci-fi for cheap pulp fiction.", 'Im addicted, and watch every episode--twice.  The look and feel is marvelous, putting us smack in the middle of Star Wars with no cheaping out.
The scripts and plot, also, unfortunately, li up to Star Wars. Terrible inconsistencies, plot holes, useless dialog (standing in front of a lava river, "Look, its the lava river)... it looks like these episodes were sketched out in a couple of days then filmed, practically ad-hoc.  Truly inexcusable. Favreau set the bar too low.

And yes, I love watching it and eagerly look forward to each new episode.', 'Amazing, this is Star Wars.', 'first episodes were boring so l give it a chance it was PERFECT and the ending left me............', 'Pure and simple...this is Star Wars!!!', 'Now this is podracing. 
After the abismal sequel trilogy this is exactly what we needed. I will never forget the last episode of this season. *-*', "The fact that the audience or the critics think this is good is a joke. From start to finish it is poorly written. It suffers from Mando and his crew being made out to be way too powerful. At no point to you actually worry for the survival of anyone. This is made worse by them refusing to kill anyone that is good. I don't understand how a kids cartoon like clone wars is killing meaningful characters every episode. But a star wars spin off wild western is scared to kill anyone good. The first season wasn't great but it was at least worry watching. This simply isn't. Disney continue to ruin and butcher star wars. I could get into why and how it's badly written but there's honestly no point. No one from Disney is going to read this review and actually take the things I say on-board. I would just recommend no one watches this shit.", 'Best Star Wars since 1983!', "The Mandalorian: Season 2 on Disney+ is one of the best Star Wars series streaming on the small screen and if you ask me this series should replace the disgrace of a trilogy that JJ Abrams put together.  This season the story continues with the Mandalore and Baby Yoda who we now know his true name Grogu. The first few episodes seemed like one off stories much like a Star Trek episode but the storyline convulsed together to bring the season to a happy ending.  Jon Favreau created, wrote and directed some of the episodes for this season and he brought back a few favorites from the past which I won't divulge. Carl Weathers, Gina Carano, and Ming-Na Wen who we thought was dead is brought back thanks to Boba Fett played by Temuera Morrison. Other notable actors such as Nick Norte, Bill Burr, Horacio Sanz, John Leguizamo, Timothy Olyphant who bore Buba Fett's amor, Clancy Brown, as well as Titus Welliver and Jason Sudeikis had small but significant roles to play.  We are also introduced to Ashoka Tano played by Rosario Dawson who did an okay job with the live action sequences. Katee Sackhoff from Battlestar Gallatica played Bo-Katan from Star Wars Rebels to join forces with the Mandalorian to retain her dark sword which the series kept open at the end of this season.  At the end of the credits you may find a glimpse of next season.  I am looking forward to next season hoping for more familiar characters we all love to be brought back.", 'This is the way, Star Wars at its best', 'The enormous world of star wars shown in this show is a place where i would love get lost in.The characters the direction the acting everything is top notch.This is how keep old as well as new star wars fans happy.Well Done Team mandalorian!!!', 'Season #1 was pretty good, but felt a bit like a made for TV show. Season #2 was movie theater quality. Outstanding!', 'This is how you end a great series. Thank you Jon Favreau for bringing back my childhood hero in the final episode, it was kick-ass!', 'Lots of fun and action packed episodes, and unlike the first season, gets much further into the Star Wars universe.', "This show is amazing incredible even best Star Wars it's amazing it's a bounty Hunter western thriller set a long time ago in a galaxy far far away ❤️❤️❤️❤️", 'Jon Favreau just showed us what Star Wars after-Lucas is! After watching the end of season 2 I can honestly say it made feel like the first time I ever saw Star Wars, the excitement, the joy as a kid being introduced in this magical world! And many years later the disappointment with the sequels, honestly I thought that was the end of Star Wars! Thankfully I was wrong, Jon Favreau and his team with the amazing cast brought the franchise back to life! 👏 👏 👏 Bravo!', "Started ok, but the flat visuals obviously controlled by the new 'AR' techniques really showed this tech isn't ready for prime time. It looks like a student project, not a Star Wars story.

It's almost as bad as fx where in late 80's, you can see the seems of the sets onto virtual backgrounds, and can see the massive limitations this puts on actors to interact and move around the sets.

The storyline barely got going, and you could have explained in 10 minutes of a Star Wars movie the entire first two seasons. Without baby yoda, this show is dead on arrival. 

Hopefully they fire the script writer 'mentality' that destroyed episodes 7-9 (officially casting them out of the star wars movies set (now there is episodes 1-6 as the 'accepted' star wars set)... sad Disney bought LucasArts, it's now a dogs breakfast of personal ideals that don't match either Disney or George Lucas's quality standards (3 out of 10) for story line, 1 out of 10 for imagination, 2 out of 10 for useful technology advances, 7 out of 10 for music arrangements. 8 out of 10 for acting, scripts are terrible, 1 out of 10. No real story arc here, just living of the star wars series and surviving because people have disney+ and like star wars, rather than because the ads draw you in. This is art, not great television.

Worth watching if you're into star wars, but don't expect to be 'wowed' other when Yoda first 'arrives' in the show.", "Season 2 was by far better than season 1... I believe we're reaching a time where film makers are actually giving fans what they want. This show is honestly a game changer and is gonna give new ideas to other film makers which is great and I love it 😁", 'The writing is terrible. The only thing that keeps this going is the cuteness of Baby Yoda.', 'the best tv series on this earth, had me at tears. well done to every one who took part. it is incredible, never seen anything better', 'Great Second Season, Din continues on his quest to return the child to his kind and meets several fan favorite characters from other Star Wars media, yet none of them overshadow Din or seem forced, on the contrary Din and the Child are still the front and center of the show and all other character appearances weave into the story and go on to make Din Djarin as one of the most significant and interesting Star Wars characters of all time. This is The Way.', 'Wow, so this is what the Star Wars movies after IV, V and VI should have felt like. Jon Favreau would have said hell no to Jar Jar. This is the way.', 'this season manages to overcome the first, being very well directed and written, it manages to provide a fan service in a moderate way, delivering touching and well done scenes, without a doubt this series is delivering everything that the new Star Wars films did not deliver.', 'Dave Filoni and Jon Favreau have once again proven why they should be the ones running Lucasfilm.  While I felt this season of The Mandalorian stumbled out of the gate, it hits its stride a few episodes in and never looks back.  Filoni and Favreau display an understanding of not only Star Wars, but its fanbase as well.  This was a critical misstep that Disney had made when they created the sequel trilogy.  Disney thought they could just take a new group of actors, intersperse them with a few of the actors from the original trilogy, shake it all up, and the fanbase will ravenously devour it because it says Star Wars on the cover--regardless of the actual story (which is equally horrid as the theme of "Hey! What about ANOTHER Death Star--but like--a different VERSION!" that gets beaten like the dead horse that it is.)  The Mandalorian performs a great deal of fanservice on its own as well, but differs in that there are REASONS that character is appearing that have been carefully crafted into the design of the script.  This is the Star Wars that the fans deserved.  This is the way.', 'If I am to name this season, it would be called: "fanservice".
I have really mixed feelings about this season. If it wasn't for the last episode I would give it a much lower score. I loved how they brought old characters back to tease their own show and I do hope they succeed. My only complain is that their presence stole the spotlight from the title character a little too much. Of course, Mando did get development in the last two episodes but I expected more. MUCH MORE. I am happy they decided to drop Grogu from the show. He had some funny moments and got a pretty cool backstory this season, which is great, however just like the old characters, he did steal the spotlight quite a bit from Din. 
Closing thoughts: I like the show. It managed to put a beating hearth back in the fandom after the disaster that the sequel trilogy was. What makes me sad is that it could be  way better. The next season will possibly focus on Mandalore and I really hope we get something deeper and more complex. It's good Favreau, you had your fun, we all liked it, now please, give us something better, I know you can.', 'Unmissable. The best Star Wars anything ever.', 'This is Star Wars! Just give Filoni and Favreu full control over all of Star Wars already.', "The second season started out rocky for me with its first couple episodes but the final half especially was excellent and was a step up from the first.  Final episode some of the best tv I've seen.", 'It sort of felt like a wild goose chase, with the overall arc coming together a little shakily. Whereas the mystery of last season is slightly less present, the action and scenery are still very effective. The live action Ahsoka Tano was surprisingly good, and it was entertaining to see the post-Empire pre-First Order universe expanded upon.', 'One of a kind! Exactly what the fans needed to see after 15 years of waiting since the last truly worth it STAR WARS movie. OMG its much more!', 'Season 2 did not disappoint at all. Season 3 is going to be the longest wait ever . . .', 'Perfection. Possibly the greatest Star Wars thing ever made.', "This series is the best thing to have happened to the Star Wars franchise recently since the Rogue One film. What's even better is that despite Season 1 being already a great show, Season 2 just got even better with the storytelling, character introduction/building, fanservice, and action sequences (plus the budget for the effects is astonishing) and now that the season has ended it has been a very fulfilling series for me. There is this thrill you'll have because they made the flow feel like an adventure with the protagonist that you can follow and admire like it's a video game with drop loads of references that shows how much the creator, writers, and directors understand the lore. All of these are what made it outstanding for a simple follower like me. And to end the whole season with a bang is so amazing. (I still can't get over it actually) I've seen a lot of reactors crying over the finale and I can see how with proper writing you can make characters, recurring or new, more valuable and their actions sensible. I highly recommend this show to everyone but it would be best if you follow Star Wars from the beginning. May the Force be with us all. This is the Way.", "Though it's not a perfect season and there are episodes I didn't think were great, as a whole it was just fun. I had a great ride and I can't wait for more, great ending.", "OMG! First of all, season 1&2 were excellent! I love everything about the Mandalorian and Baby Yoda! Episode 8 of season two was a real tear jerker but the ending was phenomenal! Love it! Can't wait for season 3! Love the Directors for a job well done! My hats off to you all!", "Unbelievable season of television. The Mandalorian is keeping Star Wars alive (from JJ Abrams and the fans who tried to kill it). If Favreau and Filoni can bring some of the magic they've found here to future Star Wars projects then I'd say the galaxy far, far away is in very good hands. As someone who loved The Last Jedi, my only critique of The Mandalorian is that it's mildly depressing that Star Wars needs to tell a mostly surface-level story in order to win back so much of the fanbase. But The Mandalorian can't be accused of relying on nostalgia to create a compelling story.", "EXTRAORDINARY!!!! Jon Favreau has achieved the impossible: pleasing all Star Wars fans!!! Grogu has absolutely conquered the hearts of viewers as one of the most engaging Star Wars characters of all time with his incredible cuteness and sweetness. Din Djarin's adventures continue to be exciting and challenging every time and a few familiar faces from other media will definitely get fans goose bumps with their epic appearances. It is a very consistent and well-thought TV show through and through, full of homages to classic movies. The ending may have brought us to inconsolable tears but we can surely expect great things from this story in the future. EPIC, just EPIC!", 'I want to offer some constructive feedback because I see potential in Star Wars on Disney+. So hopefully LucasFilm is reading these. Now I have never given an online review, but I felt it was called for as I want my Disney+ subscription to have good content. *Spoilers beware*

I see all these reviews that are great, and as someone who has just seen the movies and these shows seem filled with insider baseball, I guess I don't get it? Let me compare this to The Boys, as we now have two seasons of that and Mando. I love The Boys. I think it's well-written, well-acted, has some good action, interesting commentary and is fun. Outside of some of the action (which is questionable since most are just shoot outs), I feel Mando is the opposite. It seems like a Saturday morning cartoon but without wanting it to be that way. I will say the acting is better this season, for sure. And the visuals are top-notch. 

But when I feel more attachment to side characters in The Boys and none to Mando, the star of this show, that is problematic. Is it because he is always in the helmet? Perhaps seeing his face more would help create an emotional connection to the character. To be honest though, I think the biggest issue is lack of character development. I feel only two scenes really had impact - when he was in the forest with Ahsoka/Baby Yoda and when he took of his helmet. The acting in Pedro's face alone without saying a word was amazing. But 98% is shoot-out scenes. How can I appreciate the highs of a great fight scene without the "lows" of character development and story arcs? 

The best was Episode 7, the helmet scene and Bill Burr bar scene - the tension was palpable - that is what I want! Isn't that the benefit of streaming shows - you have time for that where you wouldn't in a movie? Leave super heavy non-stop action scenes to the theaters where I can see on IMAX. Since these are only 30 minute episodes, add 20 minutes of character development. Based on other comments, I think people would appreciate longer episodes anyway - why didn't Mando sit with Bo-Katan and ask about what other Mando are like and question why he needs a helmet as he's never heard this before? Instead he said "Peace out, gotta keep this baby moving." And why are all these other characters popping up and taking focus off the star? Because they ALL seem cooler than Mando. Although I've since learned this series is a set up for spin off series :( Isn't that a cinematic universe rookie mistake? Based on the finale, it seems like our Mando is done. But unfortunately I can't say that I'll miss him.

Hopefully they'll do better with their Boba Fett and Ahsoka series. And if we get a Bo-Katan series, I'd like to see a political thriller type feel with a lot of intrigue, infighting and who-can-you-trust? 

This is not the way...to bring in uninitiated fans.', "Amazing, amazing, amazing!!! All I can say is that the second season solidifies itself as one of the best entries in Star Wars lore in a long time. I must admit the last episode completely caught me off guard. I won't spoil but if you love Star Wars you will love the finale. All Star Wars fans alike can gather around and admire the glory that is the Mandalorian.", 'My favorite show of all time. And again, this is coming from someone who doesnt even like star wars.", "That's what I've been waiting from star wars new trilogy! Overall, I really enjoyed this series.", 'The best Star Wars content since Clone Wars', "[SPOILER FREE]
This is the best Star Wars live action adaptation ever since the prequels! 
Watching the season 1 is highly recommended for watching this series, but after getting that knowledge, this season just perfectly builds upon S1 and goes waaay above and beyond.   
It's an obvious must see and it's also worth getting a Disney+ subscribtion for!", "One of the best Star Wars content to date... Disney has something very special here. PLEASE DON'T RUIN IT !", 'Wow, just wow. This was the best thing I have seen from Star Wars, especially that final episode. How can I thank Jon Favreau?', "Season 2 of the Mandalorian faces the same flaws as Season 1 but still boasts lot's of suprises, nostalgia, action and emotion to overcome everything that it suffers from. (9/10)", "Favreau and Filoni have given us another phenomenal season of this show. The first episode was a great start to the season, reintroducing us to Din Djarin (Mando) and Baby Yoda, as well as showing us new characters like Cobb Vanth. Plus, that showdown with the Krayt Dragon was incredible. Episode 2, while undoubtedly filler, was still an enjoyable episode. That chase with the spiders gave me Aliens and Chamber of Secrets vibes. Episode 3 was amazing, bringing Bo Katan into live-action form. Episode 4 was also a great episode, bringing back Cara Dune and Carl Weathers' character (can't remember his name). Episode 5 was my most anticipated episode, and I was not disappointed. Seeing Ashoka Tano in live-action and portrayed by Roasario Dawson was incredible. Episode 6 was absolutely incredible, as they give us an episode devoted to Mando meeting one of the most iconic Star Wars characters of all time, Boba Fett. Episode 7 was a really awesome episode, bringing back characters like Mayfeld, as well as showing us how devoted Mando is to getting Grogu back, even if it means showing his face. And, the season finale was not only the best episode of the season, but the best episode of the series thus far. Two words: Luke Skywalker. Overall, this season was exceptional. Someone hire Favreau and Filoni as the presidents of Lucasfilm.", "It is a good series and it has some highly emotional high points. The finale is excellent. The acting is pretty good also. It is clearly a labor of love for everyone involved. However, some things start to irritate after a while. Why is every shot lethal? Even if it hits a shoulder? A pinkie? Why do stormtroopers wear the white overalls? Certainly its not armor, because they can be knocked out with a fist. Don't they teach marksmanship at trooper school? Why are blaster bolts so slow that people can duck out of their way? Why not keep one or two dark troopers powered up all the time? When you start to think about it there are a lot of such questions. Scifi is suspension of disbelief... but that has limits.", 'Excellent production and story!', 'Ever more Expansive and loaded with Action, "The Mandalorian: Season 2" is an Engaging new Chapter to an ever more exciting tale.', "Even in a time where Star Wars is lack luster at best, The Mandalorian brought new and interesting light into the world that the general audience has explored so little of. This was especially apparent in this season with the first live action appearances of bo-katan, and Ashoka Tano. A fresh new look at the vast universe that we've only explored so little of through the Star Wars trilogies. Lastly, the arc of the traditionalist Mandalorian giving up his entire culture for his child shows how much parents are willing to do for their child. This is just something that also intrigued me while watching the show.", 'In Season 1, we see a heartless, just-doing-my-job bounty hunter have a crisis of conscience, then sacrifice nearly everything to save a mysterious child; in the finale, we learn why.

In Season 2, nearly all the characters end exactly where they started. Some provide hints of depth and emotion but nothing comparable to Kuiil and IG-11. The only character who "evolves" throughout the season is not an active part of their own development, nor do they behave any different than they did before. It's flat.

The season has fantastic aesthetics and plenty of nods to its influences, which may excite fellow film geeks, but overall, the storytelling is lacking for non-Star Wars fans, and the finale's post-credits sequence cheapen the entire thing, leaving one wondering if it was all just intended to set up a spin-off.', 'Wonderful series. Everything I hoped to see in a Star Wars show.', 'I have waited for this for a Long Time... Long time... Wonderful story arc everthing fit together keeps you at the end of your seat with a wonderful payoff at the end. Made me feel like I did when watching the orginally Trilogy at the Theaters back in 77, 80 and 83.', 'Season 1 was great. Season 2 is greater. You just have to be patient enough to watch a few more episodes to feel its greatness. The last few episodes are exceptionally amazing.', 'Very disappointed by this season. Its felt like a bunch of side missions, with a few notable characters chucked in to keep the audience interested. There is very little use of thematic elements, it had poor characterization, a fetch quest type plot, and just lacked any sense of urgency imo. It was cool to see some characters return, and I always love baby yoda ... but i dont get the hype of this series. It just feels like something a marvel exec would produce. Pass.', 'Show just gets better and better. Showing a Reality that everyone wants to see after the Return of the Jedi exploring some of the most iconic characters which have long been waiting. Some Episodes could have been a little longer but the story, action and quality overall are far superior to most tv shows today.', "Mixing the exclusive characters' arcs with nostalgic blends of other corners of the Star Wars franchise (in all the best ways, at that), The Mandalorian's second round gives us the action, twists, and emotions that we fans come to demand from Star Wars TV, not to mention probably the most alleviating release from 2020.", "For the second season I was just awestruck ! The use of CGI and physical models was outstanding and a wonderful touch and O Maj Goode to the classics, I love that there's a possibility of real interesting characters such as thron could come to life finally. I didn't feel like the show was pushed in a direction it didn't need to go and wasn't made to make most of the fan base feel pushed to a narrative a wonderful feeling. It is really giving me hope for the future of Star Wars and I think Disney knocked this one out of the park", "Watching the season 2 finale of  the mandalorian, took me back to my childhood, and the reason I fell in love Star wars. Seeing Luke Skywalker come in to save the day, and watching it with my son, who is a new generation star wars fan, was a father & son moment. This doesn't make up for what they did to Luke's character in The VIII film, but it helps.", 'A bright hope for the future of modern Star Wars. Fantastic job, Filoni!', 'I have no words ... Awesome', "Season 2 of The Mandalorian proves once again that Star Wars can't break free from the franchise's own superficial iconography. I just got one of the greatest gifts for Christmas thank you.", "I love it! It's one of my favorite star wars shows!", "The Mandalorion's sophomore season starts slow but builds to a climatic final reveal that will have fans of this long running franchise loving every second of the series even more.", "One of the best series I've ever seen. Can't describe it. Perfect.", 'THE MANDALORIAN: SEASON 2 is a truly fantastic saga that hardcore Star Wars fans will love, but more casual viewers can follow along just fine!', "This season was almost non-stop. The world it inhabits got bigger, the character focus got more intimate, and it gave us just the right amount of fan service to make me feel like I was 4 years old all over again watching Return of the Jedi.
