It's clear everyone involved knows the lore, understands the universe they're working in and really cares about making a show that 'feels' like Star Wars.  They have had great creators so far (Taika Waititi is just stupendous both in his acting and directing) and an impressive cast. The story is fun, interesting and ties well into all the Star Wars lore.  Even with how great it's been it still seems the best may be yet to come (Thrawn!!)", 'This whole show is pretty cool! First I have to say that when I saw they got rid of the lightsabers. I was kind of surprised because that was what Star Wars was based about. But I kind of like it because Star Wars movies has lightsabers a LOT. I love the Star Wars saga, but it can be tiring sometimes. The second thing I would like to add is the emotion of each episode, something about an episode can draw you into the episode, with no many emotions.', 'I've loved The Mandalorian up until Season 2 Episode 5 where they brought in characters from animated Star Wars series I'd never watched.  An odd looking young lady was sneaking up on a walled city through a dark and heavily guarded woods.  Her weapon of choice? Two noisy and very bright light sabres.  She killed several guards with them who always seemed to have their back to her in spite of all the buzzing and flaring lights and dying screams - and radio!  She never used anything else! No kicks.  No punches.  Never used her mind to whack one with a big stick or to leap twenty feet into the air Chinese martial arts style and land in the middle of a squad.  Nope.  It was always: Hide. BUZZZ!  ZAP! AAAAAAH!  Anyway, I could tell by the way she was presented that she was some big deal of a Jedi, but her backstory seemed to be left to those in the know - which I was not.  All I'm left with is, "Okay Miss Zippity-Zap, what up?"  We also meet a woman in the walled city, a magistrate who is mostly "told and not showed" as cruel.  She is lugging around a spear made of the same stuff as Mando's armor.  For most of the episode, she acts like the spear is really cluttering up her space and would Mando please take it away.  Turns out the spear is her weapon of choice and she's some grand wooly master of the spear. Her and Zippity-Zap have a show-down - all so Zippity can find out where to find someone else I've never heard.  So, it is two characters I don't know looking for someone else I don't know.  This left my caring about these characters a bit on the disengaged side. I later learned this episode's purpose was to bring two popular animated character to live-action and their fans were just over the Forest Moon of Endor about it.  Good for them.  The fans had all that backstory to color their impressions of these two warriors.  Me, not so much.  Anyway, I'm glad Baby Yoda has a name.  It probably means "Slurper of Frog Eggs".', 'Absolutely killing it', 'Mandalorian, Boba Fett, Ahsoka, baby Yoda/gogru. and more to be revealed, what more could you ask for?', 'I believe that season 2 of The Mandalorian is near-perfect. The writing and directing is amazing. The action is just as good as season 1, and the story is even better.', "5 episodes into Season 2 and, while no outright stinkers as in Season 1, there are also no standouts or any scenes at all that I want to revisit from this season so far.   There's just no breadth or depth here.  Quite frankly, I'm bored.  I tune in, watch, turn off and then forget about the episode because it didn't go anywhere.  We're fed crumbs of dialog that have some interesting tidbits of information but, little development.  Mando finds out he's part of a cult/sect and doesn't react. No questions, no re-evaluation of his role/purpose. He apparently has an endless supply of money to vagabond around the galaxy on a quixotic quest.  With the 1/2 hour format, we're unable to develop any emotional connection to the random people Mando meets along his journey and each episode falls flat with only the hope that the next episode will give us something to latch onto.  But, I'm starting to hear the echos of that old adage—fool me once, shame on you; fool me twice, shame on me.  Disney STAR WARS is at its best in the books, which have character development and complete story arcs.  Despite lovely visuals , terrific score, and obviously high production values, this show could be cancelled today and I honestly wouldn't care.  It's time for Disney to invest in a GOT-style, flagship show with multiple connected story lines and complex characters and plot development.", 'Better than Season 1 which is awesome', 'Definitely a must, season 2 keeps improving on visuals, narrative and og star wars at its finest', 'The best tv show ever!', 'Fantastic show that does the fan service and creativity long overdue in the Star Wars world. Mandalorian could be promising, instead is cheap, characters and acting is...none; plot could be interesting but repetitive in its sorting out. Easy money for the production I guess.", 'LIVE ACTION AHSOKA!!!!!!!!', "I'm not going to pretend this is the most original or daring show in recent years, but it provides everything that it promises. It's a fun and visually appealing bad guy/mission/monster of the week serial that has enough of an overarching storyline to keep you interested. While maybe not the ideal vehicle for the crazed star wars fanatic, it has enough of the original feel and canonical references for the long time fan, but they are presented in a way that will not put off a new or casual viewer. In fact, they will probably go unnoticed to the uninitiated. It also avoids the dangers of the newer material that can get bogged down by unnecessary parliamentary proceedings and political conflicts that grinds the newer movies to an utterly boring halt. And the marketers at Disney earned their salaries with the genius creation of Baby Yoda, who draws in countless fans who would have never otherwise watched without pissing off loyalists. They really worked their Disney magic on him. This is honestly the best Star Wars material since the early 1980's.", 'Woooooooooooooooooow', 'This is exactly how Star Wars should be! For the majority of the episodes it feels as though the creators really believe that this show can stand alone as a drama, or in any way be deep or emotional, when that's not what this show is. It's Star Wars, a amazing sci fi series, that has never really been super dramatic, mainly action packed. Overall the switch to a more action oriented series is very smart. If you like to watch Star Wars tech it's great, but if you're looking for a good story you won't find one in the first four episodes.", 'I love the Mandalorian, and star wars as a whole (mainly the clone wars series) but these side missions are so f**king annoying. I know what Disney is doing, and it pisses me off. They make an amazing episode like episode 9 and 11, but then have to put in these side missions. I liked episode 12, but when someone like Asoka Tano is name-dropped, and then for some reason, Mando has to get repairs for his ship but then uses his ship to get it repaired. he could have just traveled to meet Asoka and got it fixed near her, but no. Disney wants to stretch it out for 8-10 weeks so they can release a new series after. for me it's "fine" but if you want your streaming service to succeed you can't just have 1 original series every 2-3 months. and then when you don't have an original series at all, what's the point. I'm sidetracking a little, but it is important to understand why there are side missions. and this TV show could easily be 100% on rotten tomatoes if they were not constrained by Disney+. But I can't hate on it too much, I mean, when Bo Katan took her helmet off and Mando was like "uhhh, you can't do that." it was great.', 'I'm rooting for this show.  They do a good job of evoking that old feeling of Star Wars. Yes, "Baby Yoda" is adorable, the action scenes are solid and thrilling, the CG is impressive.  What everybody else is saying, etc.  But heading into episode 12, I have my concerns.  I really want to be excited, but suddenly....clunky dialogue, bland acting and overall lazy direction broke the spell and made this episode feel surprisingly flimsy and forgettable.  The hallway shoot-outs with storm troopers seemed tired, the threadbare plot offered little to care about, the characters had almost no genuine chemistry with each other and the attempts at humor were just flat.  The action scenes still hit pretty hard otherwise and "Baby Yoda" remains endearing enough.  But do I sense disingenuous contrivance gradually starting to find its way into a show that's been mostly genuine and fun up to this point? Star Wars as it should be', "Starwars cowboy, what's not to love.", "What little plot there is for this series moves at an absolute snails pace. I've never seen such a glacial series with so little happening. At the start of Season 2 Episode 2 there is a recap of the first episode that lasts a minute. It includes the entire plot for the first almost hour long episode. The show is well made, but the producers seemingly forgot to write a script, and are stretching the flimsiest, smallest plot over the longest time and it is becoming tedious to watch. The second episode is half an hour, but feels like it drags on and on, a chase sequence copied straight from Harry Potter and Chamber of Secrets lasts an entire 5 minutes and feels like an eternity.

The plot barely moved on in the first episode, and does not move on at all in the second episode, the entire episode was a complete waste of time, nothing has been learned or accomplished by the end of the episode.

At the moment the show is just riding on nostalgia, the only way it keeps interest is in giving flashbacks to the original Star Wars. Its nice seeing some of the background characters from the original trilogy re-appear, but its a one-trick pony that is getting worn out with having no plot to keep me interested. With such a complex, detailed world there is so much to explore and so many stories that could be told, but this series just chooses to be an empty spectacle rather than exploring the lore and delivering a compelling story. If the plot doesn't pick up in the next few episodes it will totally lose my interest.

Overproduced and lacks spirit.', 'La serie es demasiado buena y te deja atento al siguiente episodio', "Exceptional, the whole story, the witty, the black sense of humor, the action, the recall from places, ships and characters from prequels and OT, the reveal at the end... Ufff so much to see and digest, a total eye candy, a real gift to Star Wars fans and for the ones that aren't.", "Its so good so far! Really love the styles, love how the show flows, its really well made and can't wait to see more!!", 'There are no words to sum up how good this season is, everything about it is great.', 'Boring, and too many filler episides.', "The first episode was great fun , Cobb Vanth was a interesting weston style character. The ties to the aftermath novels were a real surprise. Seeing a scene basically recreated from the books makes reading them feel like an actual payoff. The way the show can unite the fans by tying in the prequal, originals, sequels and legends can't be overstated. Can't wait for next week", 'The first episode of season two was another enjoyable chapter of the Mandalorian. It does suffer from a lack of narrative ambition at times and I would like to see greater risks taken by the writers in the upcoming episodes, but a hefty amount of fan service and typically stunning visuals have made me excited for the rest. I only hope that it can branch out from the first season and really put a stamp on the Star Wars universe.', 'Love the feel of season 2 so far, ep 3 was God-tier. Amazing storytelling and 10/10 action.', 'Great season premiere and great nod to the Aftermath novels, with the addition of Cobb Vanth and how he acquired to Boba Fett armor. Epic, cinematic, and also a lot of fun.', 'What a great start for season 2, Really amazing.', "Minor Spoilers: Episode 1 of Season 2 wasn't bad, it wasn't great, but it was good. Most of the plot seems to be lifted from eps 1,2, and 4 of season 1. So if you've seen those you already know what's going to happen and pretty much the conclusion. It didn't tie into a larger narrative for the season and was just a stand alone action piece. Don't expect much baby yoda (the child) he more or less is there, and they remind the audience from time to time by cutting to him to let everyone know he is still in the show. Cobb Vance was interesting but with a reused plot for the episode (eps 2,4 of season 1), they didn't do as much with his character as I would have liked. There is a big reveal at the last moment of the episode that I wish they would have gotten to sooner since we ALL knew it was coming. All in all it's an okay start, like the first season, but not as good as it could have been. What keeps me watching is only because I'm a huge Star Wars fan, if I wasn't then it would have lost my interest.", 'Amazing, just as good as the first season!', 'Its just like the first season but bigger and better', 'its just as good as the first season (which was great)', 'After the first episode all I can say is: wow, just wow. I am speechless. The vastness of this episode with some fantastic jaw dropping moments plus beautiful landscapes of the sandy Tatooine deserts. This episode lives up to the hype.', 'Mandalorian is back in town', 'Good startoff, nice ending!', 'This is the way!!!
I hope the series never ends with Din Djarin, Baby Yoda, and his friends!!
Every episode has a great lesson! 😊💖', "First show,  Not the best but still highly entertaining.  Design of the Dragon was disappointing.  After both Tremors and the worms from Dune this needed to be a realistic, completely different type of animal.  Just wasn't imaginative enough.", 'The Mandalorian Season 2: Episode 1 was a fresh return to the action that we had come to love in Season 1. Much of the action that was packed into this episode helps the Mandalorians story continue to develop and help him on his quest.', 'Great season, better than season 1 IMO. Good story progression and world building. Wonderfully crafted with care. PogU', 'Wow! Just wow! Talk about a strong opening. With the introduction of Timothy Olyphant and with an action packed plot The Marshal sets a very high standard for the second season of The Mandalorian.
This might be the best episode, this show has offered thus far.', 'Such a brilliant opening episode for season 2!! Just makes one grateful to be alive to see such amazing work! 10/10!!!', 'The first episode had so much hype to live up to, and delivered in a big way.  I will be watching it again as soon as I wake up.  Brilliant!', "overall pretty good, can't wait to see episode 2, clearly there's another Mandalorian and I'm sure that'll tie into the next episode 10/10"]
Review_critics: ['Where some will be down for the expansion of this story into the larger connected universe, plenty will morn the loss of what was the most unique piece of the on-screen Star Wars universe to date.', 'With its vintage charm and disheveled muppets, The Mandalorian offers something more powerful than reinvention or aesthetic avant-garde: the decadent comfort of the known. [Full review in Spanish]', "After The Rise Of Skywalker's disappointment, this franchise is finally on an exciting new path. This is the way.", 'Dhat Dave Filoni and John Favreau have done with this series... gives new life to the franchise. [Full review in Spanish]', 'The Mandalorian is a joyous example of how to exist inside a well-worn world with panache. Long may the Force be with it.', 'Now I see what all the fuss is about.', 'Aa laboratory for experimentation and recycling and, above all, a firm commitment to the future of the franchise. [Full review in Spanish]', 'More consistent than its previous season, it delivers popcorn entertainment out of this world. [Full Review in Spanish]', 'An emphatically enjoyable ride.', 'The Mandalorian\'s second season is not as plot oriented as its predecessor, this is more a "monster of the week" kind of season. Lots of fun anyway and wonderfully shot as well.', 'This season features great characters, moments, and episodes that will unite Star Wars fans everywhere.', 'Another solid season in the galaxy far, far away, though that galaxy is starting to feel awfully small.', '"This is the Way" is a fitting catch phrase, because The Mandalorian really is the way Star Wars should excite you, surprise you, and keep you wanting more.', 'The inconsistencies of the show are frustrating, but so much is forgiven by how much they nailed the relationship between our central pair.', 'Where Season 1 sometimes struggled to maintain a coherent arc, though, Season 2 has a higher-stakes narrative thrust that builds momentum more effectively.', "Any attempt to create new characters like Werner Herzog's mysterious Client or Taika Waititi's IG-11 droid are thrown out of the window, with the makers taking the lazier step of filling the world with existing characters.", "It's no small feat to create a character who is well-rounded and sympathetic, while mostly hidden behind an expressionless mask. But all the credit goes to Pascal for imbuing the man, also known as Din Djarin, with layers of ever-present depth.", "Aside from just being watchable TV, The Mandalorian season 2's real strength is that it's great Star Wars.", 'It has elements of the original trilogy and the prequel trilogy -- as well as the prequel lore -- that I love. It takes the best of both of those worlds.', 'Seeing something you love get such a well crafted, scripted, directed and acted show made it impossible to wipe a smile from my face for hours after watching every episode...', 'This S2 has been much better argumentatively speaking, going deeper into the characters and with a more linear story. Visually it has been spectacular, with fights and chases worthy of the big screen. [Full review in Spanish]', 'If season 1 was about bringing in new fans to the Star Wars galaxy far, far away, then it seemed like The Mandalorian season 2 was about rewarding older fans.', '[The Mandalorian Season 2] feels like it is at a very definitive crossroads.', "It's Star Wars in its purest form - spare but sprawling, elegantly intimate yet epic in scope, appointment TV at its best.", 'Narratively, this is among the strongest ever tales to bear the Star Wars name, with an ending that leaves you craving more of the same.', "The Mandalorian feels like Star Wars because Favreau and company, including Clone Wars showrunner Dave Filoni, understand the formula. And it's paying off. In these tense times, the audiences are eating it up like comfort food.", "We're in an age of TV where so much money can be thrown around and it doesn't work. This is throwing a lot of money at something and it does."]

Review_audience:
["Just finished Season One of Turner & Hooch, and all I can say is more, please! I BEG OF YOU!

Watching this show gave me such joy <3 Great characters. Great writing. Great entertainment for the whole family.

The original Turner and Hooch was a favorite of mine and my Dad's so I was thrilled to see that they had continued the storyline. My father passed away in October 2021 so finding this treasure in March 2022 has been a blessing.", "This show is so much fun. It is entertaining and exciting. It is hard to find a show that the entire family can enjoy. Really like the concept of a follow on to the original movie.  The characters are great and we are learning a lot more about dogs by watching this show. It is one of those shows that just make you feel good.  After each episode we can't wait to watch the next one. I really hope it gets picked up for a second season.", 'Fun, enjoyable, easy romp.  Nothing special here besides easy to love characters and a fun plot.  Individual episodes are easy to follow but the season keeps you coming back for the next episode over and over until after episodes 12 you miss going back for more.  
Personally, I really hope Disney brings us season two.  Disney+ needs more sitcoms to keep us coming back to the subscription.', "I like it, to the haters out there stuff you, there is a over abundance lovely graphic content programming for you to take your fill on. So why when I a nice serious comes along do you all have a hissy, please let have something to watch that isn't full of sex,violence and drugs, but still has a bit of substance, dear lord is it too much to ask. But hey ho the haters have got their way as usual cancelled after one season,  not happy,  personally I was looking forward to some more, let's hope Disney can sell it to another network 😊.", "This show is cute, funny and exciting. Turner & Hooch the movie was my favorite movie as a kid. Now I get to share this series and the movie with my children. All of the actors are perfect and who wouldn't love a show with an adorable drooling pooch.", "One of the first Disney+ shows I absolutely love, besides the Mandalorian. I watched this with my family and all of us were hooked, which rarely happens because we all have different tastes. Josh Peck is awesome. Good for him, he deserves a successful show like this and hope to see him in more movies and shows! I also hope Tom Hanks makes a cameo appearance, since Peck plays the son of hanks' character from the movies. Even if they are like childhood flashbacks would still be really cool.", 'I loved it and how ur attention is grabbed from the beginning of the season …. Season 2 is a must have', 'Absolutely loved it, really hope there is a season 2 coming! The whole family enjoyed it and had a laugh', 'pure entertainment please make a second season it is fantastic check it out now', "Love this show!! And so does our Dog! We can't wait for season 2 :)", 'Excellent family show for parents and preteens!', "I'm not much of a television watcher, but this snagged me and took me through the whole season at once!❤ I loved how Xavier and Erica kept me laughing non-stop! Hope to see another season! 🤞", 'Amazing Family Series', 'Love this family friendly show!  We could not wait for episodes to drop!  Hoping for a season 2!!!!', '"Turner & Hooch" is a slightly likable series that appeals to a family audiences but it's surprising story may have successfully made it binge-worthy but it's handle makes it less mature than it's predecessor that originally starred the legendary Tom Hanks.', 'Amazing-fun and family-friendly show where each episode makes you want more and wait until next week. Funny moments, action, good personality and makes a smile on your face. Also, you want to see in an S2 more and more and how Erika and Turner finally engage (with their dogs too! angela and Hooch who deserves to be a couple!). I hope Disney continue the show in an S2 and I recommend it to all people who give it a chance. You, your kids and your family will love it!', 'Great show to watch with the kids. My daughter looks forward to a new episode each week.', "A great show.  This is one that my whole family enjoys!  That hardly ever happens.  We have teens to young adults.  Please renew! It's nice to sit down together and watch something we all like!!!!!!", 'Great show, entertainment for any age. I hope they renew it for multiple seasons.', "Besides it being slightly predictable, I love the cheesy comedy and light-heartedness. It's a fantastic break from the serious dramas that are overwhelmingly common these days. I loved it.", "Love this series. I learn things about dogs every show. Yes its cheesy, goofy, silly, and light hearted and even stupid. Its called entertainment. Its not suppose to be serious. Its heart warming and loving and interesting and has a little action.  Like all shows that exist there are a few things in the series that are off putting. But overall the show is excellent and well worth watching. I love it and have watched every show 3-4 times. I cant believe that when a light hearted show comes people want more of the junk that is out there. I'm tired of hateful shows where people are not supportive of each other or shows about murder. I'm tired of killing and hating. There is none of that in here. Just watch it. But watch it all.", 'Tuner and Hooch is a great show! Me and my son enjoy watching all the episodes. Please keep this show going!', 'So far this is a very good story line I love the dogs and episodes although not sure Scott turner is wise about love...hope he wishes up soon so far up to episode 10', 'Amazing show,
I wait for the new episode every week', 'Oh MY God, what utter and total RUBBISH. Episode one starts with nearly no explination of the time line between the movie and who the dweeb played by Josh Peck is. This TV show will never stand up to the movie. US Marshalls? And are they suggesting that Scott Jr is a cookie cutter from the OCD dad? Don't get me started on the acting or should I say subpar acting. There was better acting in "the Room" with Tommy Wiseau.', "It's a good TV show I really hope it would be more adult like Big Shot but other than that it's a good show to watch", 'I Love It,Is Funny,Entertaining,Beautiful With Great Story,Character and I Love Hooch And Of Course Peck Incredible.', 'I was on the fence for the first couple episodes, but by episode 5, I found it quite enjoyable and easy to watch!', "A decent family show with action and humor. The interplay between the characters gets more interesting with every episode. I especially like the interaction between Josh Peck's uptight, fastidious US marshal vs. Brandon Jay McLaren's inscrutable, spaced out version, which gets funnier over time. Vanessa Lengies is delightful as the dog trainer with eyes for Josh's oblivious character.

I like that the writers are taking their time with Hooch getting training, as it creates plenty of opportunity for things to seemingly go off the rails, and lets the character development happen gradually, which I appreciate. 

The show has good stunts for a TV show, and at times has intense though bloodless violence that may catch some parents off-guard for very young viewers. A few lines uttered during or immediately after fight scenes were surprising and brilliantly funny. 

Matt Nix has created a nice show here, and is letting the characters evolve pleasingly over time.", 'I loved the acting and the story, but the biggest win for me was that my 13 year old made Wednesday's a "must-see-family-TV" date, which is an added and rare gift.  It's kind of rare to find a show that my wife and I, and our 13 and 16 year old all love.   The only complaint I had is thinking about all the paper towels and 409 I'd have to buy cleaning up after Hooch.  He's a lovable TERROR!', "Surprisingly has solid action scenes that are not meant for young children under a certain age. The script is very well written and keeps you engaged and laughing or smiling. I love that the plot points are about crimes. 

The characters are the best part of the show because they're so likeable and relatable. The engaging performances of the actors and actresses are what really help to seal the deal. I have to give a shout out to some excellent directing choices that elevate suspenseful moments.

I also love that there is dog knowledge shared throughout the show, especially when it relates to police work. It was a great idea to have each episode have its own crime to solve, but that the show is setting up an overarching mystery that keeps you on your toes. I highly recommend this show!

Thank you to all involved for creating such a sweet and endearing show. I'm hoping it'll get another season after this one.", "I'm enjoying this show a lot. The cast is great and the dog is adorable.", "Turner & Hooch is a new version of the classic from the 80s perp in its first episode it is very poorly executed we have a more childish look than the original film, we have characters that still do not connect with us the audience, the protagonists still do not develop very clearly but hey we're still going through the first episode so the story can develop", "I'm going to be honest. The show isn't that bad. I go as far as to say it's a pretty good start. But that's my opinion. I enjoy Josh Peck as Scott Jr. and his dynamic with Hooch. I can't wait for more..", 'WOW. I hope ep2 is better. Gal is pregnant and working US MARSHALS???  Forget the baby! Also no seatbelt for her in car. This will be interesting for sure.', 'Funny family comedy I liked episode 1 as it showed how turner had trouble with hooch as hooch helped him in a crime mystery']
Review_critics: ["There's crime, there's action and there's even a love triangle. It makes quite the package, we reckon!", 'You may not have asked for a Turner and Hooch series, but it may just be the inoffensive, low-stakes series you were looking for when you need something easygoing.', 'Fans of the original may mine some nostalgia from this new take on the story but beyond that, this series should end up in the pound.', "It's fitting that McG would direct the Turner and Hooch pilot because it's about as inoffensive and bland as most of the director's output.", 'Turner & Hooch could deliver a solid family dramedy or a mindless action-comedy; by trying to be both, the show ends up neither.', 'Unfortunately, at least in these first three episodes, the show is too caught up in recreating the squabbles between Turner and Hooch over and over again in new scenarios.', "One difference between the film and the series - and it's a pretty significant one - is that Josh Peck is no Tom Hanks. Another difference - again, pretty significant - is that it's not 1989 anymore.", "It's fine. And it is always good to see dogs getting work. Though, babe, you're not credited anywhere. You need to bark at your agent about that.", "We'll be honest here: We're recommending Turner & Hooch mostly for the dog.", 'Fans of canine chaos, exasperated Captains, puntastic episode titles (A Good Day to Dog Hard, Diamonds are Furever) and a little, low-key potential lurve should find plenty to enjoy here.', "There's a good bit of action and a lot of humor, both involving Hooch and the various people in Scott's life. However, there's a lot of room for improvement.", "Given that many shows struggle to find their footing early on, Turner & Hooch finds its footing very quickly, and I'm excited about what the future holds for the series.", "I'm not even complaining when I call Turner & Hooch a forgettable, one-joke series. It's hard to know what else it could have been.", "Even if Hooch sits at attention like a good dog, after a few episodes of Turner & Hooch, it's hard to share that patience or loyalty.", 'Nothing feels dumbed down or muted, though the dog dilemma involving Hooch being thrust upon an unwilling owner feels like a questionable situation now instead of a light-hearted romp.', "It's not very good, but I guess that means it's paying homage to the original.", 'It leans much too hard into the corny aesthetic of those kinds of lighthearted dramas, creating something too silly and childish for most adults, yet likely too old-fashioned for their own children.', "While paying respectful homage to the original film and beautifully continuing its legacy (it's) not afraid to forge its own path. Plenty of laughs, great action set pieces and great characters make for an enjoyable buddy-cop series for all!", 'Dog-loving teens may enjoy this show, which is relatively tame in most aspects besides the violence, but many will roll their eyes at the cheesy dialgoue and storylines.', 'Cute family fare and an endearing dog.', "Turner & Hooch gets the reboot approach with Josh Peck taking over the leading duties but Tom Hanks's presence is still felt in the series."]

Review_audience: ['I love cartoons and the animated series spotlighting Wolverine was good to see!!!!', 'One of the best, if not THE best, Marvel cartoon of all time!', 'historia maneira foda açao tmb']
Review_critics: ['Ultimately, the program is reasonably good fun for X-Men aficionados, but the reliance on past movie and comic references... blunts the appeal, as does the occasionally stiff animation quality.', "Blame whatever you like- the blatant Wolverine pandering, the departure from tradition- but the interest just wasn't enough to continue the story.", "The question heading into the third part of the season finale remained whether they'd be able to pull it all together in an entertaining way that still felt logical. As it turns out, the answer is mostly yes.", 'Where the series really succeeds is in its wide use of characters major and minor, all pulled from the comics.', 'Though aimed at kids, Wolverine and the X-Men has enough depth to appeal to older fans of the popular Marvel Comics franchise as well.', 'Wolverine and the X-Men also succeeds in bringing the sheer variety of characters to life without making the show feel crowded.']
